IIfjLcpFPUdW8st3gcj3dQ.text: Went on Google maos....and found this place as we were on vacation in Las Vegas. ..  Fairly new place,  pleasant polite staff. Food was really good and filling.  Definitely would go back here....  So if your traveling through check this place out.....

ViZ0-CL1B0yUqb0hKa7ytw.text: Great from start to finish. The people behind the counter were attentive. The food was fantastic and what a great idea! Pick your own pasta and sauce! It was delicious

Irq6qqiKTAjbMNZdv8Ct3A.text: Outstanding food. Fantastic service. I had the baked butternut squash ravioli with speck and mushrooms in a white sauce which was delicious.

SJT90vAj2M3w7fWnqTfakA.text: This is the best Italian food in Las Vegas. I', totally addicted to this place. No one is better then this. I'm so glad I live 5 mins away. If you get a chance please try it. Guarantee you will love it.

swRtt7NQNJU6yWD5FgXkfw.text: Amazing! Small and cute. Clean and bright. Great service from Isabella. The Putanesca was terrific. Seafood dish as well. Fresh ingredients and a very talented chef/owner. We are local and will be making this a regular stop!!

0yRAwl_bKlTx-1qYnmCD9Q.text: Fresh pasta. Fresh sauce. Fresh dining. Great service. Food was amazing. The lunch special was priced great and the portions were quite large for a lunch plate. I hope this place catches on and stays around.

WEGSSXdgu-qfsyBUOI3BQg.text: This is my all time favorite little restaurant! It is tucked away in the corner of the shopping center, like a little jewel.The food is just amazing...fresh, flavorful, and different. If you are looking for something  special this is your place!

00ftDwUY_4lnKD8G_v80OQ.text: Great little place with terrific food.  Caprese salad was as large as I've had anywhere and good! I knew it was going to be good when I heard the chef pounding the veal and chicken in the kitchen. Veal Saltimbocca and Chicken Parmigiana were both outstanding. We were starving so we tried the meatball appetizer as well.  Took half of each meal home. Also an outstanding variety of pastas available. The Gnocchi are next on the list. There were also nearly a line for take-out orders as well while we dined in.

kqfANUKFO127xbnKdeBa0w.text: Stumbled across this place on accident with my mom and sister and I'm SO glad we did. Let's start with the decor, It's fresh and clean with the cutest decor hanging on the walls really makes it feel like home. The food was absolutely outstanding. Nothing we had was less than amazing and there was so much we ended up taking a lot home. The service was incredible as well. Jeremias welcomed us as soon as we walked in the door. He was so friendly and answered any questions that we had. He was more than happy to stand and talk with us and definitely added to the experience. This was our first time here but we will definitely be back!!

2tg8sWKmUgXDObTlfSej9Q.text: I had the Arrabbiata sauce with the thick spaghetti and it was delicious. However, this place gave me the worst case of food poisoning I've ever experienced. Half an hour after finishing the meal I got the worst stomach cramps and threw up several times. It was accompanied by the other fun symptoms of food poisoning and I was out for 3 days. I even had a fever the second day. As amazing as it tasted I think won't be returning. It will be a while until I will have pasta again, the sight of it makes me a bit queasy right now.

l1DSjouUP2Qhjz2l1_ZqKQ.text: We were so excited to finally try this place. Unfortunately, it did not live up to our expectations. I ordered the Chicken Piccata with Papardelle pasta. The only thing I could taste or smell were the capers. There had to be at least fifty if those very strong tasting berries. There were no herbs, no salt, and certainly no garlic. If there was, it was undetectable. After three bites, I just gave up. Sadly, the chicken was undercooked. I would understand if they had just recently opened, but that wasn't the case. To add insult to injury, with tax and tip it was almost forty dollars. As the food was to go, I couldn't even return it so that they could recook it. I was going to call and complain, but after reading other diners reviews here and the way they described managements handling of issues, I decided it would be a waste of time. I truly feel cheated. It's an awful feeling when you were expecting something else.

UMkZ7POK7SKQc2T6IiRrbw.text: Best pasta I have ever had. No kidding. The pasta is homemade and all the dishes are delicious and high quality. The owners could not be more friendly. This place is AMAZING!

Eig4a_os4fHUL5XDw6WfNg.text: What an incredible surprise! My boyfriend and I stopped in on a whim and WOW! The service was wonderful but the food is what we will come back for again and again. The truffle burrata special was delectable and the fresh, house made pasta was exquisite! In fact, the food was so good we asked to compliment the owner, Andrea. And yes, he is straight from Italy. My only minor complaint is the ambiance. Radio with commercials and the sound of the dishes being washed are not the best but you will not walk away disappointed!!

3JZoY6oJjWJhQsUPH_O6Ew.text: Wow.. So refreshing to have a real Italian taste in Las Vegas. Thank you Andrea for sharing your amazing kitchen with us. I had Andrea special. Bigoli pasta with meat sauce. Amazing.

k8rjvMqVKFkKwRWKIV0jhw.text: I love that this small business opened up. The owners are so sweet and always make sure the guests are happy. I've been here twice and loved everything I've had. Their spicy Diablo pasta is one of the best pastas I've had...ever. Their specials are also great. I will definitely keep coming back!

vTEJtP0cgDS0om2lM061jA.text: I'm stuffed!   If there was a 10 star review I'd use it here. The place is super clean, the staff is extremely nice and attentive, but most of all the food... The food is heavenly! I started with the house salad and ordered the Bigoli pasta with meat sauce and meatballs. The salad was as fresh as any I've ever had. It had olives, tomatoes, and buffalo mozzarella on it. Simply divine! The pasta dish was insanely good. Best I've ever had at a restaurant. The meatballs were perfect in every way!   If you like clean, healthy, delicious food, just go here. You will not be disappointed.   I'll see you there tomorrow, because I'm going back!

Etp5Z_U9cH_bJhf5lglO3w.text: I love this place! They have great fresh Italian food.  Guess what??? Everyone who works there is Italian!  I had pasta with vodka sauce, shrimp, scallops, asparagus, mushrooms, and tomatoes.  My friend had fettuccine Alfredo. They started us off with fresh bruschetta. Delish! Soup and salad. Delish! Service was superb! This is one of my new favorite spots!

Vy-5ZZ9CUY_B6FI0kUOfTQ.text: First time to visit with a friend today and told them we had never been there before .. All tables which isn't many were dirty and place is super small ... Gdqd6LfKvrSZsZeJn4ra7A.text: I just got here but am rating it 5 stars. Why? Because the service is great and all I've had to eat so far is the complimentary bread and it too was great. I don't even like raw tomatoes,  but I cleaned my plate. I'm coming back!

wVH4pBkZrjZqLESzhBDlVA.text: This place is great. Best pasta and great way to order sauce. Fresh homemade pasta and yummy sauce. People that work there are super nice. Had dinner there with wife and baby. Super kid friendly. Great for take out or delivery too.

6nC-aXPP2Q-Sekv_k0fkpg.text: Food portions are a 5-Star.  Food quality 3.5 Star  Restaurant is just a few tables so no way to give that more than 2 stars although it's clean it's just a sliver of tables and they are pretty full.   Take out service 4 Star  I need to try more stuff in the future but here is what I've tried: Baked rigatoni:  4.5 star   (Portion size 5 star) Ravioli with chicken marsala sauce (3 star)  Garlic Bread: 3 star  Fetuccini alfredo: 3 star   (Portion size 5 star)   The portion size is the big plus for this place and the food is pretty darn good! sOWEZp5u_JoYx2Epyglf2A.text: Pastaidea is amazing! Their pastas dishes are THE BEST PASTAS my wife & I have ever had at any restaurant in the US...EVER! I have never eaten better pasta in my life and I was born and raised in Italy. Only restaurants in Italy are better, or on par with this place. The sauces are flavorful, authentic, and made to perfection!!! We love the food here so much, we eat here twice a week. They also serve garlic bread with bruschetta sauce for free as part of your meal....which is also fantastic. The service is prompt and friendly. The prices are fair, since the quality is soooo good and the portions are huge. ENJOY!!!

it5oNEHV6-jb1S8hm3dGfw.text: I love this cute little cafe. I had ordered from them a couple of times on Postmates but I had never been inside the restaurant. It's super adorable and quaint and the food is delicious as always.

PGrfKDZiMQOIap8pDXVgVA.text: If you're looking for some good pasta - come here. This place is one of a kind and totally worth it!!  Big portions, delicious, and well-made. The young girl that works here has a fabulous personality - very friendly and funny - she makes our experience great every time. My boyfriend and I come here often but we are about to move, so this place will be for sure missed by both of us. So go in and grab a plate for us since we can't anymore, you won't be sorry!! Vd3d8MKErryxl4UrcrkAEw.text: The pasta here is so yummy! You pick your pasta and then your sauce, voila!, a customized pasta dish to your liking. :P They even have a big poster with pictures of the different pastas they make - easy reference when you don't remember what's what. They also have a specialty menu if you just want to try something they put together and, even better, specials of the day! So many options, you'll definitely find something to hit the spot.   This was my second time here. I got one of the specialty menu dishes - the butternut squash ravioli with speck and mushrooms in a 5 cheese sauce. SO GOOD. I definitely recommend this dish! I mean, it was the dish that I ordered the first time that made me come back today. :) Also, they give you a plate of bread, with tomato in a bowl if you wish to add that on top. YUM! Writing this review is making my mouth water. Haha! Okay, back to the review...  Service here is amazing. The waitress and waiter are always stopping by to see how we're doing and if we need anything. It's a pretty small space for a restaurant - about 4 tables that fit 4 people (5 if they add a chair to the end) with a couple 2-seaters, if I remember correctly. Then there's also outside seating too. If you have a big group, definitely recommend calling ahead so they can put the tables together and reserve them for you. That being said, once the kitchen starts cooking a bunch of dishes, it gets a little hot inside the restaurant. Overall, definitely a spot I will be coming back to and recommend others to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butternut Squash Ravioli with speck and mushroom in 5-cheese sauce!

S4UvSNhXBtiniDul5V0kGg.text: Great home made pasta.  Chose a pasta- add a sauce. Very casual interior, more atmosphere in outside seating . We tend to order pickup and share one order as the serving is generous.

bwTowcN_7FzdnpnK8Bao1g.text: Sorry, We used to go here but it is not the same The previous Italian owner is gone and the new.people who used to work  them now runs the place Will never go back.

YDN9H0Ot44qQFFb6CvUGmA.text: This little pasta place really delivers on quality and customer service. The idea is simple, pick your pasta and then pick your sauce. I've been here multiple times and each time I've had something different because it has all looked good and I've never been disappointed.   The staff is incredibly friendly and they're always helpful when I've asked for recommendations. The garlic bread is a great way to start the meal, and then your main course comes out, the portions are big, I always have leftovers and I am very happy to eat them later.   If you come during lunch, check out the lunch specials.

QKkrQHiqmkq1YajauYEo-Q.text: The food was really good! The pasta was fresh and the sauces were delicious. We ordered a variety of dishes ranging from seafood, chicken and meatballs in various white and red sauces. They were all very good!!! The meatballs in the spaghetti was flavorful as well as the white wine sauce with clams. We live in southern highlands so the drive is pretty long but we will keep going back and would highly recommend! The staff were so friendly, the service was excellent! We didn't wait that long for  our food, maybe because there weren't that many people. But there were 9 people in our party, kids included so that's pretty good. We were there on Sunday evening, so maybe that's their down time...not sure. We love this place! Will be coming back for sure!

L-m8HuPP09aYRoV2SdsmuA.text: Pastaidea is definitely a good idea. You want to do this, you need to do this. This is a small shop with available outdoor seating as well. The concept is simple, pick a pasta, then pick a sauce to go with it. However, the food is anything but simple. Without belaboring the point, the entrees were surprisingly delicious. Actually, some of the best pasta dishes I have had in a long while. Served fresh and hot. All said and done, our two entrees came out to about $20 each. Not inexpensive, but worth every cent. I highly recommend Pastaidea, you won't be disappointed.

dp_UiHXzvHenqRHqqPKR2w.text: Great pasta and sauces, it was all very fresh. I Had the carbonara, my boyfriend had the pink diablo and we also shared lasagna for the table. The carbonara was the best I've had in town. The Diablo was like nothing I've had before so flavorful and spicy, delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m7AxvzpgeJrEnEK5VacpGA.text: Not often dish out five star reviews but Pasta Idea was on point from the minute walked in the restaurant. So many five star things that love about this place! First foremost love seeing small business/family own restaurants succeed in Vegas. Pasta Idea is truly one of those spots in life.   Shout out yelp family for telling me about this great hidden gem in Vegas. As in hidden if your not looking for it probably going pass by it. It depends on the direction coming from on Lake Mead Blvd. I just about passed it myself. Pasta Idea located in tiny shopping mall tucked in the corner next to Cafe Rio. In the same area with bunch of office buildings.  They have daily special board right outside. I came for lunch with another yelper Suzy H. So best things about dining with yelpers get to try lot of food!! It was my first time Suzy H second time got the low down on the menu. The thing Pasta Idea is know for is all there pasta are fresh. FRESH!!!! Sold!! The difference between dry pasta and fresh pasta are worlds apart. Outside of the strip I have not found many italian restaurants that serve lot of fresh pasta. Am sure few do serve some but all the pasta on the menu? The thing is not just your typical common spaghetti, fettuccine, etc. Bigoli, Cavatelli, bunch of different ravioli,and even gluten free fresh pasta. Truly pasta shape for everyone. Sauces. They have bunch that can choose from mix and match with your choice of pasta. Endless possibilities of pasta heaven! They do have lot of set pasta dishes on the menu. Full menu. The appetizers ordered the Prosciutto crude and fresh mozzarella appetizer. Talk about da bomb. The prosciutto was sliced perfect nice thin slices. Really could have order pound of that just go cold cut and be content in life. The mozzarella also amazing. The freshness was on point add drizzle of olive oil and seasoning. It was the perfect starter. I ordered the Bigoli with meat sauce. It was amazing. The Bigoli was cooked to perfection combine with full hearty meat sauce. The portion size is ridiculous. Unlike chain restaurants not only full portion but packed with flavor. I was surprise finish the whole plate but it was that addicting. The price. Steal of deal. Lot of the dishes are under $20 dollars. If looking for something more affordable then going out the strip for great pasta Pasta Idea. The garlic bread with the tomato bruschetta on the side. Easily the best garlic bread had in long time. Not only is the bread hot, seasoning perfect balance not garlic garlic but clearly taste other seasonings, and bread nice toasted crust when pull piece apart yay!   Pasta Idea is tiny restaurant. Couple tables outside. I do love the art work on the walls. I love the vibe small family run business. No doubt plan on coming back because pasta combinations are endless. Delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bigoli Pasta with Meat Sauce
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto cruda and fresh mozzarella appetizer (amazing!) and garlic bread comes with lunch special.

ETwV4aGviURoK8NKdFTIjw.text: The pasta here is awesome. Very cool and simple concept- pick your pasta then pick your sauce. Portions are generous. I chose the butternut squash ravioli with carbonara sauce and I practically licked my plate. Meatball sub was huge. Kids Mac and cheese was delicious. Hubby had lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce and was pleased.  Only downside was the decor was not up to scale with their prices. Each plate is about $15-20.   Service was very good. Friendly and courteous staff.   Will definitely be back

Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball sub

y1DJOqP4TQsuCJxHkDvTWw.text: (unrelated) mother f... this is the 3rd time i had to re-write this dang review. freakin yelp didnt save it even though originally it did GRRRR  SIDE NOTE - THEY HAVE TO REMOVE THAT PastaIdea Radio. Or implement a function to turn it off. It turns back up on max volume when you change pages. UGH  ANYWAYS... this place is known for its homemade fresh noodles and sauces made in-house daily. There used to be a place on the SW side by Flamingo and Grand Canyon that had a similar feature but they disappeared only after 2 visits.   PastaIdea has a "Lunch Special" which allows a selection from a starred (*) noodle and matched with a starred (*) sauce for $9.95 including a fountain drink and garlic bread (Available for dine in AND take out !)   I had originally came here prior to meeting my accountant to do some taxes. I dont come to this side of town too often which was why it took me so long to visit this place. PastaIdea opens at 11am and i had came here shortly after. Located on the NW corner of Lake Mead and Buffalo, its in a small shopping center between Bucca di Beppo and McDonalds. It kind of "hides" in the middle of the center facing away from the parking lot but its there.   Its a small little restaurant with maybe 5 tables seating 20 people total. Since the restaurant was empty and im not one to like to dine alone, i opt'ed to take it out to eat next to the lake at Desert Shores... xD   Picking fettuccine noodles matched with arrabbiata sauce, they were both starred items which worked with the lunch special. As mentioned before, the noodles are fresh made as well as the sauces. The arrabbiata sauce is made with a spicy marinara and olives. The marinara is fresh and bright. The spice was a small kick but not as spicy as i had preferred. But for a nice warm day with a small breeze, it was nice. The fettuccine noodles were nice and al dente. The olives was a mix of green and black pitted olives and there was quite the generous amount. Having bursts of flavor from the olives with the generous amount of noodles and marinara, it was a good amount of food, especially for lunch.   As mentioned before, it comes with garlic toast and a side of tomatoes mixed with chopped basil, which gives it a very refreshing, bright taste when you put it on top of the toast and eaten together.   Second time i had came here, i had picked something not included in the lunch special (as i dont know when the next time i'd get the chance to come here, so i "went all out in a way"). I picked the fresh cavatelli pasta this time, which are like small long pasta shells, similar to mini hot dog buns. LOL I paired the pasta with a creamy white sauce, the Veneto, with asparagus, grape tomatoes, proscuitto crudo, and mushrooms. Proscuitto crudo is essentially the typical proscuitto you are probably familiar with. Crudo means raw whereas cotto means cooked. The sauce was SUPER heavy and creamy but worked well. Grape tomatoes cut in half punched through the heaviness fairly well. Proscuitto gave it a nice "natural" saltiness to the bite with the earthy taste of mushrooms. My only real complaint is the asparagus was tough to eat. Had some very tough pieces so they needed a trimming. The cavatelli pasta was AMAZING. VERY al dente with its elasticity and incomparable bite.   With the choices of 16 different noodles paired with 40 sauces, the combinations are almost endless. I would love to return to try other sauces. It does get a little pricey because of the sauce costs in ingredients they use probably, but once in a while, i think its pretty worth it.

Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine with arrabiata sauce

tq5QbRyn7lxs1EMSYPWhng.text: This was ok. I like that it's a small business and I like supporting small businesses, but there are still some kinks that need to get worked out here.   The food was ok, you basically create your own pasta which is nice. Our food took reallly long to to get, when my mom got her food hers was cold. I assume they weren't  expecting a busy Mother's Day.   I thought the staff was knowledgeable and very sweet. They gave all the women flowers and the mothers a special Mother's Day dessert for Mother's Day which I thought was really adorable. Yet another reason I like to support local businesses.   I don't know if I'd go back to this restaurant ...possibly if they drop the prices a bit, because I don't feel that the food was worth the price.

ICtAAvKZJsK0gr5UeLCBwQ.text: I came to this tiny spot on a whim with my MIL and was surprised by the delicious pasta that it's become a mainstay for me and my family. I feel like I need to come once a week.   They make the noodles in house and I'm a sucker for fresh pasta! Then there is a large amount of sauce choices. They also have a chaulkboard outside with specials and they do a lunch menu too.  I have a few favorites; I enjoy their pink sauce quite a bit and tend to lean more often than not to order something with it. It's definitely my favorite pink sauce out there. My two favorite combinations is fettucine with the Pink Diablo sauce (pepperoni,sausage, pepperoncini,sundried tomatoes) or pappardelle with the mushoom proscruitto cream sauce. I generally have liked everything I've ordered though! The only thing I was neutral about is the fra diavolo seafood pasta and meatballs. Their portions are hefty here so you will either get the itis eating it all or have enough for another meal. I admit to having had breakfast spaghetti a few times.   The gals here are super sweet to boot. I have come here only once on a weekend and found it crazy packed since theres only like 5 tables so I tend to eat here weekday nights.   If you love a hearty satisfying pasta meal, this is a great bet for quality, portion and friendliness!   Definitely one of my favorite new finds in town to dine at after a long day at work.

_kH5wZPSqLpQP53KouV6Eg.text: Hidden little gem! What's cool about this place is that you can customize how you want your pasta dish to be. I mean it can get pricy if you keep on adding more stuff to your pasta or even what type of pasta noodle you get. We ordered the chicken parmigiana and pappardelle with a meat sauce and meat balls. Let me tell you the portions are HUGE! I feel one dish is enough for two people. The chicken parm was so good. Maybe a lil better than most top Italian restaurants. The pappardelle was not bad I felt the noodles were a lil hard side and not al dente. The sauce was on point tho. Before they serve the main dishes, they give you bread and fresh tomatoes. I want to go back and try their ravioli!

JCQ3jHq0QERJqlkgy1oHuA.text: Verrrrrrry Tasty!   My wife and I have come here a few times and the food is excellent and the people working there were extremely pleasant.   It doesn't feel like a sit down place, although they do have a few tables.  I have dined in and had trouble with the comfort of the chairs - while stylish, not so good for sitting in.  This is more of an order and take to go type of place in my opinion.  Why three stars and not higher?  Because it's pricey in my opinion for not being a sit down type of place.  Ya pick your pasta for one variable price and then your sauce for another variable price.  Again, eating goodness but I actually went, "damn!" On the price.  Thus, the other day after craving pasta and thinking of this place - deciding to pass because of price (for a mostly take out type of place).   It's worth a try for sure - but not sure I am to be a regular even though it's less than a mile from my house.

Last night I put in a take out order that took well over an hour. The workers were unpleasant and basically ignored my group. When we finally left we ended up with pasta that was mediocre at best.

UozDeRiMgPbvE9wE1GvqWQ.text: Holy ravioli! This place is G.O.O.D. In my family, comfort food = pasta; we eat it at least 3 times a week, and have a make-your -own-ravioli party every Christmas. This is by far the best pasta restaurant we have come across. A couple of tips: 1) Get it to go! The restaurant is small and every time I've been there it's had a weird smell, almost like a sewer problem. 2) Skip dessert - their chocolate cake looks tempting, but when I tried it I was disappointed that it was pretty dry and had that refrigerator taste to it. Oh well, that just means you have more room for pasta!  Pasta Idea has become a new staple for my family whenever we're in town. New York has the pizza, but Las Vegas has the pasta!

TlQFkZm18WoTcyD5jlNc_A.text: This place is a joke! Being run by "teenagers" who are in need of going to school for business management.  We came in yesterday at 8pm. Everything was good until our food came. My husband ordered the special of the day with the "meat sauce" etc. The pasta was super dry and bland. So we asked our server for extra sauce on the side so the food won't be so dry. They gave us marinara sauce ONLY.  Another teen came by the name "carrie" and we told her were canceling the order. She insisted on making another one but we said no, it's fine we don't want it. She replies you can't do that. She then takes the food to the back. When we were finished with our meal, she hands us our receipt and said we had to pay for the pasta we didn't eat. I refused to pay for something we didn't eat but she kept insisting we pay. When I ask for management, another young teen with a beard, said there's no management and no contact of manager. I asked well what happens if there's an emergency? He replies, this is not an emergency. I told carrie, I refused to pay for the pasta cause we didn't eat the food, if I have to, I'll pay my only bill I ate and will call the cops to escorts us out. Then she  blurts out, we're a small business here and your no longer allowed here. Totally fine with me, with the bad customer service I doubt I'll ever step back in. I ended up paying only for what we ate and left.  Too bad, this place could've been good but with the lack of knowledge of customer service, it shows a lot they will not succeed in business.

JYF4t-iyjW4NTJP45K9L1g.text: I was at Cyndy's party and I have to say, the best pasta ever. The gnocchi was delicious! The antipasto fantastic. So fabulous of Pasta Idea to come to our rescue. I'd go there anytime.

iOpUeu1STrOyLVcicujYdw.text: Awesome!!! Cute small place with delicious pasta! Love the spicy marinara! Great service, huge portions! Going to be able to get three meals out of it.

A5XYDB6V6wuCXmdyTdwmYg.text: My girlfriend is a New York Italian and grew up on home made pastas. This is the best either of us has ever had! Incredible food, very generous portions, and exceptionally reasonable pricing make this place a must try. We'll be coming back here every time we're in Vegas.

qv7Hr7728M9n4Y9vQjyWxA.text: It was super yummy!! There was four of as and we all got different things to eat. The portions are very large and also the breadsticks are very yummy this is not a whole lot of seating about six tables. Not for big groups of people. They do have catering and also take out.

btxzlJKMfx30C3H5U0cSYg.text: Ordered 200 ravioli for a party and they were great. Butternut squash was the favorite and the mushroom ravioli was a close second. Smelled wonderful when I walked in, so I was reassured that my blind decision to use this place for my party would be okay. Will definitely go back.

ur-L7ExsI9NNxRWkGSIwPQ.text: Havent tried the food yet, waiting on it as I write this but the customer service was terrible. I walk up to the counter and start speaking and the older blonde lady rudely interrupts me as I'm trying to ask a question (being a first time guest) I'd like to ask how things work, so she says the other lady will be right with me. So I wait, and wait and the other lady steps to the counter and asks what I want and I tell her. She said that they were busy which there's 7 tables literally in the entire restaurant and people at 5 of the 7. I work at a restaurant and know what busy is and this was not it. So I sit at a vacant table as I wait for my food to go and the older blonde lady brings food from other tables to the vacant table I'm sitting at to box for her leaving customers and literally scrapes the food into the boxes in my face, I'm surprised she didn't get any of their half eaten food on me as a sat there. Literally the worst customer service. Good luck going here.

JuHcj0D0Eq2NSorQb8tRPQ.text: Love love love the shrimp and crab baked ravioli in the five cheese sauce.  The place is small and not very visible from the street.  They are trying to get outdoor seating which would help with their presence.  I will definately be back. The staff is outstanding.  Very friendly and welcoming.  Next visit I think I'll try the mushroom ravioli.  Nice variety of sauces and pasta that are fresh and oh so tasty!  They are also working on a beer and wine license.  I ask our server and she said it was permissible to bring in your own wine.   We were thinking of Buca di Beppo for lunch and my husband suggested something different.  This resturant is just east of Buca on Lake Mead Blvd.  So glad we popped in.

A3a-lb1EjaO3oRAAJt162g.text: Walking into this place, it seems very small. It has a very cute eating space and our server was very nice. The variety of sauces, meats, and noodles are extensive! That is not a bad thing. You have a lot to choose from and they help you if there are things you do to understand. The meatballs were so good. I chose the creamy alfredo diablo ravioli! If you like it a little spicy, go for it!

dcdAcltuGMmbfwaI0J6Igw.text: One of the best places in town for pasta dishes with qualify ingredients, delicious recipes and real Italian flavor.  The have a serious variety of options on kinds of pasta, types of sauces and the repertoire of ingredients.  I like the ravioli dishes, mushroom and butternut squash, but the meat dishes look spectacular.  Generous portions is an understatement.  Not for the gluten free crowd.  Service is good but not for large groups.

J6u2D6heSuHcmKRVw6Gh_Q.text: Very friendly staff. Big potions. Nice presentation.  Tasty spring mix salad. Absolutely delicious mushroom ravioli! 8Hr7dDlRdtG1Vrb60cim9w.text: A tiny little hole in the wall in the north Summerlin area; tucked in a hidden corner so you might miss it if you aren't paying attention.  I think it seats less than twenty people, so don't be surprised when you walk in.      They offer wide arrange of homemade pasta and it's all good...  You get your white sauce, red sauce and pink sauce.  Every time I bring people here, be it friends or business associates, they are always pleasantly surprised with how good the food is.    Come try it out and make this hidden gem your go-to pasta place.

7DgxGBYEjf2tQ4cqg7Xovw.text: Pastaidea is good and it's definitely on its way to being great. However, they have some kinks they need to work out.   I arrived Monday evening and approached the counter to order to-go. There was only 1 other couple dining in so I was approached quickly by the staff. I felt a little rushed to order as it was my first time but they were really friendly. I ended up choosing the cheese tortellini with pink sauce, asparagus, mushrooms, grape tomatoes and chicken then a nutella cheesecake for dessert.   The wait was short and i was on my way home with fresh, hot food in about 20 minutes.   When i finally opened the bag up i found the sauce leaked out of the paper container the pasta was in and I was missing my cheesecake! It was frustrating to clean up the meal prior to eating and I live too far away to bother returning for my cheesecake.   The food i did eat was great - flavorful and large amount that i'll be eating throughout the week.   Despite the kinks and paying for something i didn't receive, the food is worth returning for. I'll just be sure to take extra precautions from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese tortilini with pink sauce, asparagus, cherry tomatoes, mushrooms and chicken
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauce spilled out of paper container during trip home.

r7wc2oMpT6eaQ3IrVlCRSA.text: We've  came here with 6 people and it was a disaster. There was no place for us to sit so we pushed two tables together to accommodate. Both the tables were broken and shaking but we stuffed napkins to make it work. The service was AWFUL! There was hair on one of the breads and I put it aside but then 45 minutes after we ordered our food, I got my plate and there was a longer black hair in that too. GROSS!  we sat there waiting for almost an hour and didn't get a refill until the food came almost an hour. I asked for a lemon for my water at the beginning, when the server came out with the bread, and a third time when she came out with the food. I never got a lemon, even though she kept on saying yes I'll bring it. We should have known it was gonna take forever when the uber eats guy started yelling at his customer service because he was dispatched to pick up food and was told he would have to wait at least 20 min. We had to split the check 4 ways so we each individually walked inside to pay. My husband is 100% sure, he told the lady what our order was. As we were walking out, the server that has given us this horrible service yelled at us that we haven't paid for my dish- with the hair in it. I want to make it clear we are not the type of people that would just eat and then leave! I walked inside with my husband and pointed out the terrible service we received. The eloquent response I received was "ok?" We settled the bill for an additional $20 for one plate of food!!!! This place is a joke and I hope they get shut down by the authorities. Who know what else is going on in that kitchen.... do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

JPKU0dCOBMKEj17ruJ6xcw.text: I love Pastaidea!! Been here a few times and everything has always been great! The staff is super nice and the food is absolutely delicious!!   Ordered online this time via my mobile phone and it was really easy to navigate and process my order. There isn't any details about the sauces when you order online so have the menu pulled on on yelp for guidance. Two things about the online ordering is that when I ordered online it said my order would be available at :25. I arrived at :26 but didn't leave until :45. Not a huge deal but maybe if you're pressed for time better to call ahead to make sure it's ready!! Also in the "special instruction" section I requested mushrooms and it looks like it didn't process to them. Minor flaws in the online ordering method.  I advised Juan about the wait time and he was really understanding and so incredibly nice!!   *ordered Pappardelle w/ Carbonara

zzD3kSOytcB58Emm6Oo22g.text: I've never tasted and experience such unique pasta options in my life!   I am impressed with how many types of noodle they offer, the various sauces, and the overall menu selection. For noodles, they have the basic spaghetti and fettuccine, as well as interesting ones like butternut squash and spinach ravioli. For the sauces, they have red, pink, green, creamy white, and seafood. Plus specialities pastas, a kids menu, and desserts!   Best of all, they have a lunch special for $9.95 that includes a noodle and sauce of your choice, a drink, and garlic bread. Dine in or take out. You must try the fettuccine with the basil pesto creamy sauce.

It's a dive, which is fine, and not a deal breaker for  me generally, but the service was painfully slow, the food was absolutely awful, I mean, I couldn't even eat mine it was so bad. My boyfriend was starving so he ate his, and I'm not kidding, he was actively suppressing the urge to vomit as we waited for the check. Now we both have messed up stomachs and let me tell you, we paid alot of money for our upset stomachs! My pesto pasta was $17!!! My boyfriend's vomit pasta was $19!!! Stay far away from this place!

All of the tables were dirty and the food isn't even worth the shitty customer service any more as it seems like it's not as good as it used to be. The waitress( an older white skinny lady) actually came over to our table while we were waiting for our food and began wiping it down. Not only did she decide not to excuse herself as she literally leaned on us to clean the table she actually wiped the crumbs on the table on us.....  ..... I can't make this shit up.   Just expect terrible everything and you won't be disappointed.

Rod5T-Gp37-b6KOKO-BIyg.text: Our favorite pasta house in Las Vegas. We've been coming here for years. If a restaurant can get better with age, this one does The pink vodka sauce is a definite must. Go with whatever the server suggests - they've never steered us wrong. If I could give 6 stars I would.

Awt5EAW1WHLh-Dg2lJ42WQ.text: It's imPASTA-ble to describe how much I love this place but I'll give it a try!   Whenever I'm in the area or whenever I'm craving pasta (which is pretty much all the time) I love to go to Pasta Idea, especially for their lunch special. It's $9.95 for a create your own pasta (only the ones with a * next to it are eligible) plus a drink and garlic bread with a side of tomatoes and chopped basil. Keep in mind that if you aren't dining here for lunch, the pastas can be a bit pricey BUT the portions are so huge so you can definitely share with another person! They also have delivery through Eat24 and BiteSquad if you just want to eat in but still get your pasta fix!   For lunch I recommend their pink vodka sauce with spaghetti noodles or their caprese with their cheese ravioli! We usually get those two and always end up super full at the end of our meal.   The space is pretty small so not ideal for huge groups but I'm sure they can be accommodating since I saw a huge group of 10 today when I picked up my order. Their customer service has always been great (I really miss those two sisters that worked here, haven't seen them anymore though :/) but today it was even more awesome since the guy was able to expedite my order because he knew I was in a rush despite how busy they were!   Love how their pasta and sauces are handmade and always fresh with authentic Italian chefs behind the kitchen! It's definitely a nice difference from the typical "Olive Garden" or other chain restaurants. I also love supporting local businesses so this is the ideal go to pasta spot for me!

EncZAPiqDjRXRTOpDjQ9Vw.text: Officially have eaten here twice. Only have tried the chicken ceasar salads but boy are they great. The aromas coming from the kitchen make you want to know more. The flavor profile says this isn't fast food and we are giving you a glimpse of real Italian food is supposed to taste like. Yep. I'm getting this message from the bruschetta.  Laugh if you want but you need to try it for yourself.

NSwTh_9WZIWcnFlIt2WYOg.text: "Wow, what a great find" was something my wife and i said .. well paraphrasing of course while we ate our last minute dinner at this new pasta joint.  We ordered a kids mac and cheese, a chicken parm, and lasagna.  Lasagna: cooked perfectly. Great taste with lots of layers. My only complaint was that it was a tad bit dry... and i mean just a tad. 4.5/5  Chicken parm: it was my wife's meal and it was a big meal if i must say. Lots of great flavor and chicken cooked just right. 4/5  Mac and cheese: was absolutely delicious! I was hoping my kids didnt finish it and i was lucky enough to eat a couple bites and had the opportunity to finish it for left overs! The cheese on that though..... yummmmmm!!!  Oh! And their garlic bread with tomato dip! Wow. Yumm  Love this place. The venue is small, but cozy. Service was friendly and fast. My only complaint is the overall price. $15 -$20 for each of the adult meals and i think about $10 for the mac and cheese.   But, I'd definitely go again!!  Added pics!

UBZJjQTUkMM2iD1rS6cJcQ.text: This is one of the newest restaurants in the Summerlin area.  Their concept is good and very interesting. You can select your pasta and the sauce you want. Their pasta is homemade authentic italian. You have about 10 different pasta options to select from and over 20 different sauces... They have it all! The portions size are very generous, you will for sure have left overs! I went over for lunch and they had a lunch special of pasta and a sauce plus and drink for 9.99. However, the offer is a bit deceiving because you can only pick two or three sauces for lunch. The rest of the menu was full price.  So at the end we spent about $15 each, which sounds a bit much for a lunch entree. Especially when you can go to olive garden and have all you can eat soup or salad and a pasta bowl for $6.99. In my opinion those two restaurants are similar in taste. The flavors were good, but nothing memorable.

wUqI3JjiwRfkYrP2f79SDQ.text: Cute little restaurant that is great for a good quick eat or take out! You get to create your own fish by choosing your pasta and sauce separately. Most of the sauces come with meats and/or veggies in it. The menu makes it simple to pick what you want by dividing the sauces up by the base. Everything tastes pretty fresh. They give you garlic bread with a tomato spread that I could eat foreverrr but had to stop myself so I had room for my main dish. I tried the pappardelle pasta with imported porcini mushrooms and prosciutto crudo. The sauce itself was a little bland but the prosciutto provided the saltyness it needed. Definitely add black pepper. I also tried spaghetti and meatballs. The sauce was really tasty. Meatballs were juicy and so tender on the inside. The sauce also comes with meat chunks in it as well.

ZehXBfMe4R2_Gm8nAxeoVw.text: Came here for the grand opening a couple months ago with my friend and it was the best pasta I've ever had in Vegas! I believe it's a family owned place and they're extremely nice! Definitely worth it and the portions are great and filling too! Go when you have the chance I promise you won't regret it!

cE0-4SpHw62Dr9xn0HA_ZA.text: Really good pasta it's homemade and you could choose what type of sauce you'd like, also they give big portions

FBrkTavZNyf1Sj3Q_KIrKw.text: What a find! Being new to the area I relied on my Yelp reviews and it didn't disappoint.  If you enjoy spaghetti and meatballs, this is delicious!  Meatballs moist, well- seasoned and melt in your mouth.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and I'm picky.  The garlic bread was amazing.  If you're into wonderful food and ambience isn't important this is a place you must try.  If you're looking for fine dining, try here another time.

-ZHpMNfgvQocsUfMxCan2A.text: My husband and I wanted to try a "new place " for dinner. Found Pasta Idea read the reviews decided to give it a go. We were not disappointed at all. I love the idea of picking your pasta and your own sauce  combo.  I ended up getting the Meat Lasagna  (AMAZING) my husband ordered the spinach ravioli with the Diablo sauce. Great as well.  This place is small and set back in the corner of the center. Not easy to find if you dont know it is there. But so worth looking for it.  The staff was so friendly. We will be for sure going back

BDa6qj9LSv6AeF7UOZZc9Q.text: Amazing idea. Pick your pasta, then pick your sauce of which there are so.many it's hard to choose. All freshly.made from the frying pan to your table. Very small place so if 4 or more call for reservation. Portions are large.

Zo80-TMvkFUXQ_B1Ugu84A.text: After building up a big appetite chasing mice and cat interlopers through Pueblo Park in Summerlin, I found an hidden gem in a generic strip mall across the street. You choose from  a wide variety of pastas, Bigoli is my fave, and then choose from a wide variety of sauces  to go with. I've tried quite a few and they're all excellent I but I can't resist going with the basic marinara with meatballs. The way I see it, if an Italian joint a good 'marinar', why deviate.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Rigatoni

mfAW1DGL9uzeADMTmX52ew.text: Absolutely delicious! At first I was disappointed because they were out of gnocchi, but I ended up getting the five cheese baked butternut squash ravioli and it was spectacular! It came as a large portion with a creamy, sweet, and rich sauce. The sauce has mushrooms and speck, and the ravioli were tender and filled with creamy butternut squash. My boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana. It was huge and came with a side of spaghetti and marinara. It had a great coating and was topped with bubbling cheese. It was a little pricey, but absolutely wonderful. I will be back for the gnocchi!

0JO1defvToxnq8pQ-yQZ8g.text: We ordered an order if spaghetti & meatballs and a Caesar salad. Both were fine, not the worst but not the best either, just ok.

aCC1P0o68p0LfKM97Eo0qQ.text: Hands down the best pasta experience ever a must try! Pasta is made here and the sauces are incredible.  If you have a request they works with you better than any other pasta restauraunt! The best!

ABuREe64zh1AuWomv1Fcdw.text: The Pasta is really good here. It's tucked away in a semi hidden location in the center back of the shopping center.  Keep in the mind the menu prices, its pick a pasta which costs a few dollars, then pick a sauce that costs a few more dollars.  So you add up the two prices to get your total, unlike most Restaurants with a single price.    The Restaurant only has a few tables inside, so come early, whether for lunch or dinner.  Overall, the Pasta cooked is perfect, and they do the sauces well. The food quality is tops here, just the menu is a bit confusing.  A good place to go if you're willing to head out to Summerlin area.

5bXIPJVtYZIRKZhohN0E-w.text: OMG it was so yummy. So many choices. You pick the pasta you want with the sauce you want. Everything is home made and delicious

Y25Evv146x_ZjvGKEKEWhw.text: Just tried this place tonight and it was AMAZING. So many different sauce options; I chose to get the pesto & goronzola mixed with the pesto ligauria (not sure if I spelled that right) and the cheese tortellini noodles I chose had a very good flavor and texture. Seriously the best pasta ever, and I'm Italian. Haha. Oh, and their Nutella cheesecake is to die for!!  My order was a to go order, for the price you pay the servings are gigantic, I only ate less than half of my pasta and I'm eating the cheesecake as I write this review, seriously though, if the pasta had sucked (which it did NOT) I would still come back just for this heavenly cheesecake    So I'm pretty much in love with this place. Strongly encourage everyone & their mother to go here!  And I really, really, really want to buy an entire Nutella cheesecake from you guys and just eat nothing but cheesecake for like a week. (Seriously, this needs to happen)

IZZ5tnUzMn1sfqwh7gx2OQ.text: Second trip in this place. Second time I have been thoroughly impressed. The owner lady is who waited on us. Love her to death and she is definitely Italian.. The food here is made to order and is always hot and very fresh. The wait staff is always concerned with how the food is. I can not think of a better italian place here in North Vegas. Will be returning here often..

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat lasagna and red diablo pasta.. Delicious

C6Ekoiib4yHdu2VMICo38Q.text: Ok, can't express enough of my frustration and anger towards this restaurant. First, the night before I order a couple of pasta dinner and a dessert and had the lady repeat my order, then my wife came back with a soup instead of dessert and was charged for it, and today, again i order spaghetti and specialty pasta (baked butternut squash ravioli) got home to find out that they gave me Rigatoni w some red sauce,and what irritated me the most is that I gave the guy a tip for making sure that I have the right order this time (of course I didn't checked because its tightly tied in the bag already) but how incompetent your staff could be!the first time, I could let it by, simple mistake right but second time in a row! Come on now! Driving 22mls to your restaurant twice to hopefully enjoy the pasta I was craving and you messing it up twice!  WARNING for patrons: Make sure to visually check your pick up order before leaving, therefore you'll avoid disappointment when you get home Update: After expressing the issue with Carrie she immediately offer a full refund on the item that was missing and I said no need for refund but she offers an invite to make up if I'm willing to come back which I did along with my family. This time no disappointment and she was very accommodating to us and we had the pasta that I had been craving. I was solved! Important note: this is still my go to place for pasta fix, incredibly good spaghetti, fresh taste and very reasonably priced.  Again, thank you for making the best pasta in my town!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked butternut squash ravioli. So tasty, flavor explosion in your mouth!

BIB4_vL56COLFspSIbON7g.text: The family atmosphere is a good start to saying this is homemade food. I will have one complaint... Today the air conditioning was out and bathroom...just happened to see an earlier review about this location that addressed it.... Peoples.... Its about the FOOD... Ironically I was contacted by Bucca Di Beppo earlier today ( see that review).....The food is fresh flavorful from the bread to the soups to the main courses... I cannot afford to gain another 40 lbs so bettrr have no dessert. I had the baked mushroom Ravioli and sampled garliclover shrimp alfredo lasagna mac n cheese and gnochi... I found all to be worth additional visits.....

H7VDx9ruDr6_7IyLrd4Spw.text: First time guest and this place did not disappoint. Very warm and friendly service, loved the small cozy atmosphere. We had the spaghetti and meatballs, clams in white wine, baked butternut squash ravioli and tricolor noodles in creamy pesto sauce everything was delicious. Definitely recommend this place if you are in the mood for great Italian food.

prmkY7yCcK9k170Ur-NiHw.text: I ordered delivery and the app wouldn't let me add the gate code, ,so I called the restaurant to give them the code to give to the driver. The BITCH who answered the phone said she wouldn't take the code to give to the driver. Because the delivery is done by Grubhub and I should call the drive. Real smart how am I supposed to call the driver if I don't know who he/ she is?  Even if their Ford turns out to be the best in the world I wouldn't order from them again.

G5YFW7Ts_oVFGQ9_8fmgSA.text: Nice family owned spot, small but they are very welcoming and the food is always fresh and great!!

LyJNNVf6OSYNwxaO6BCJcQ.text: My family will only go to Olive Garden for Italian food, because you get the best bang for your buck there. Unlimited amounts of breadsticks, soup, and salad, and you're too full by the time you get your entree so you just take it to go. Yup, we've all been there. Anyhow, I came up with this "idea," (hah) that we try a different Italian place where they handcraft their own noodles, and I convinced them that it would be a lot better than Olive Garden. Sooo, we ended up coming to Pasta Idea about a month, and sadly, they were not convinced. At least I got them to try a place other than Olive Garden haha.   They strictly serve pasta here. No fried foods/appetizers so ya'll gonna have to get your calamari fix elsewhere. The four of us shared a cioppino, the pink diablo, lasagne, and a chicken alfredo, all with spaghetti pasta. They don't have linguine, but their spaghetti is similar to linguine. Portions are pretty generous. The pink diablo sauce was definitely the highlight with its smokey and spicy flavors. I would ask for less pepperoncini next time though, because it kind of overpowered the flavor of the pasta. Cioppino was pretty good along with the chicken alfredo. All the pasta was a little chewier than I would have liked, and the lasagne was ok, not the best that I've had. However, because they offer so many options, I am willing to give them another try. Service was great. The ladies (possibly the owners) serving us were very cordial.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X7W49I5rEDeplBxNzoAJ3Q.text: I truly enjoy PastaIdea. this small restaurant packs a wallop in flavor and portions. I order the Chicken Picatta with Spaghetti noodles( I wish the had Angel Hair) and it was 1 of the best I've tasted. Hot fresh And Lemony with a generous serving size.

IkuKIRNCU6-GCVUoCKvHCA.text: Great place, really small and intimate with outdoor choices. The food is great, the side salad is so fresh and quality greens and fresh mozzarella ball. The pasta and sauces are 14-22 dollars depending on your choices but they are hand crafted and super flavorful. Not your cheap neighborhood pizzeria, more like your little piece of Italy in your backyard.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu for Pastaidea

jPGJaYsRiU_se_UJzphxkQ.text: This place is a hidden gem that satisfies my Italian urges. Cooked with love like a fiery Italian nona would prepare for her family. Why pay twice the price for on strip mediocrity when you can get quality fresh pasta right here in your own backyard

aieX4Hw66yRSZgpTyxBQUA.text: This place is awesome. Their baked butternut squash ravioli is my favorite and it's just amazing. Though probably not so good for the waistline. The noodles are obviously made fresh and I haven't met a sauce yet that I didn't really like. My personal recommendations for sauces are the Campania, Amatriciana, Trentino, and Marsala.  One thing that needs to be mentioned is that seating is EXTREMELY limited. There is seating for maybe 25 people comfortably. There is a little more seating outside, but I have never done more than walk by the outside tables so I can't say for sure.

CIBIDl-v_IZrWQ-Djf3Tjw.text: What refreshingly delicious little gem. Do yourself a favor and support this authentic family run Italian joint.

61CqOaGgAPvj38qlXd0RgQ.text: My husband and I are worldwide travellers and this place by far has some of the best pasta dishes we've ever had in the States.

NUQIrhqeCbqPwMRj-b3Alg.text: Great Italian food. They work so hard to keep customers happy and provide excellent food and service. Love them!

kzP6V_76qfuLRutI2FWB-w.text: Great little 8-9 table place tucked back in the i Renee of the strip mall. Went we two friends. I had the lunch special of spaghetti and meatballs for $9.95 including a drink. Sounded expensive at first - but take a look at my picture, enough for two meals plus! The pasta was a thicker noodle with tasty meatballs and plenty of red sauce.  The others were cheese ravioli and chicken Alfredo.   Both plates were generous portions and steaming hot from the kitchen - no warm up or microwave here.   Enjoyed and looking forward to returning to try other pastas.

ozkfRhNzrVwbmaFVId7vAQ.text: I have been coming here since it first opened and have always thought that the food was excellent. Yesterday I picked up two orders of Chicken Parm. While the pasta was good, the chicken was tough and the breading hard which indicated to me that it was precooked and reheated. As I have had this before we could tell the difference. Sadly we will stick to Pasta in the future.

pXmRpaD9bJaZEuwEa-tG0g.text: Seriously the best pasta. Restaurant quality and service is great.. people are very sweet. My favorites are pasta ramagna, shrimp and scallpos fra Diablo. Cheesecake is so fresh and homemade. Love this place and I order at least twice a week.

Cz2u7RXcGZW8Ombf2KRmxQ.text: What can I say other than amazingly good Italian dishes that after eating there more than five times, I have not been disappointed.  All of their pasta, but one, is made in-house.  Try the spinach ravioli with the spicy meat sauce.

ac480BEQs9_TvJjl-msajw.text: Love this place. The meal was started with amazingly fresh bruschetta. Then I ordered the sausage onion and peppers over spaghetti. I loved the sauce. Serve was great. It was kinda a hole in the hole, but the food was great.

p8Gir-Jqin6QMyOXGG2DAA.text: This pasta has set the benchmark for delicious.  12/10 would recommend, lots of sauce and bang for your buck.

TI26OFpkIHJVTVbw6l9IXA.text: This place is small but totally makes up for it with flavor. I really appreciate that you can customize your own entree. Pick a type of noodles, choose a sauce and meat and there you go. I ordered shrimp and scalops in a creamy white sauce with rigatoni noodles and it was delicious. I think spaghetti would have paired better but I was with co-workers and didn't want to make a mess. The garlic bread is very good. The exact crunchy and chewy combination. One of these days I'd like to try the spicy red sauce.   I wish there was a location closer to my house.

dyv9PPSk7SQItMDDRLFdsw.text: Pretty cute restaurant. Clean and nice. Very good food. They have a lunch special which is good. A little pricy but acceptable.

Ogk38PLk6h1guYX8XOXz9w.text: On New Year's Eve,  my caterer didn't show up.  I was stuck with no food and 20 people in the house.  So I looked on yelp, picked Pasta Idea based on ratings and boy I was not disappointed.  I called them at 7:00pm and explained my predicament and they had food for 20 people ready for me by 8:30!  Thank you Pasta Idea for saving my butt but also for some amazing pasta.  You will love their home made pasta and sauces!

OdLGwWNDO2l_sWOL9JWx5g.text: I ordered 3 spaghetti and meatballs dinner for delivery 7pm. I was not notified that they received my order, but the monies were immediately taken out of my account. I called the restaurant, and they could hardly hear me. I had to shout very loud. I don't know why they don't answer their phone in a quieter place. The background noise in the place was very loud. I hope I get our food tonight by 7pm.

FreyuImIyn-5ajfvp2dlJA.text: As soon as I walked in and heard the owners' Italian accent, I knew the food was going to be amazing. They started us off with garlic bread with a side of marinara and a side of chopped tomatoes with basil. IT WAS SO GOOD! Then, I ordered the ravioli with caprese sauce. The food was so fresh and delicious. The portions were crazy huge- my plate could have fed 3 people. I ate lunch at noon and six and a half hours later, I am still full (even though I had skipped breakfast).  I wish I had a place like this in Dallas!

UmclNeSPW10krPsldmE9KQ.text: Too bad. We used to eat there frequently when they first opened and it was good. Over time, the quality started to drop - especially the quality of the proteins (meat, chicken) - so we stopped for a while. We tried it again after a long break and found that quality had dropped even more! The carbonara sauce we had for example, had mystery pancetta in it. All the pieces of pancetta were some strange mangled sinew and fat that once in your mouth, you have no choice but to spit it out (how gross) or gag on it! I never even knew it was possible for Pancetta to have sinew and chewy parts like that. It was Disgusting! The Veneto sauce also seems to have suffered from cutting corners on quality of the speck in it. It also was very skimpy on the asparagus, and half the cherry tomatoes were still green! I believe this was the last chance we're going to give them. Instead of maintaining quality or improving, they seem to be slipping into a very nasty place with questionable ingredients and no quality control. Paying almost $70 for 3 very bad pasta dishes, seems insane. So never again!

uMlWx8KNl0dXLPAii3qqgg.text: been coming here for a while now. always got the chicken parmesan with alfredo fettuccini for $14.95. came today and the guy tells me to substitute spaghetti for Alfredo parmesan is $10. I said are you sure ? he said yeah. I said ok. so I paid $25 for chicken parmesan and fettuccini alfredo for one person. today was the last day I will ever eat at pasta idea. if you feel like getting over charged for decent food. come here !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $25 for this ? never again

G3C3T5GTrRAA8BfLv-RZpQ.text: Loved this place. Decided to look for some good food elsewhere instead of paying a premium on the strip. Found this place after reading some good reviews on yelp. The place is small but the food was awesome. Fresh pasta and freshly made sauce. Family owned and the service is great. The portions were very generous and they were willing to make variations to suit our taste. The dessert and coffee was great too. We ordered the spaghetti, gnocchi, fettuccine and rigatoni. Loved the fresh taste of the pasta.

4ZZNJFbkhX73Qnwum_N8lg.text: The best Italian food I have ever had and you will ever have. Drops the mic and walks off to finish eating.

PlOztCXLDCRF3L4r1QD6Kg.text: Just opened today and the food is fresh and authentic. The hospitality was great and we even got some free samples which were also great! Hope they keep up the quality

3D1049x7-vxwHTAXOCDbXQ.text: The pasta is great. It's a little tight inside and they get busy, but that's forgiven because it's so good.  We've been here several times, gotten different dishes each time - all always good, especially the pink vodka sauce.

S1oI5GpHuZKB7XT8q_AtKQ.text: Ok, Ive been back a few times, and I've tried the basic marinara, and it definitely stands out! It has a great rich and tangy flavor.....you could put it on cardboard and I would probably enjoy it (although it's even better on their gnocchi). As promised, I'm bumping up my review to 5 stars. I honestly struggle going out to "casual Italian" restaurant because I always feel like I could have made a better meal for much less, but this place is unique. It's very fairly priced, and everything is made fresh from scratch.

uZOb1ZDvSGURdg5b5QYZzA.text: Very very good I asked them to make me anything of their preference and they did not disappoint.they gave me some amazing bigoli with their diablo sauce and it was more then amazing.their excitement on surprising me made it more then a delight because I can tell they enjoy what they do and what they do is amazing I recommend Pasta Idea to anyone looking for some good home made food with an amazing environment

E7EspnZZkpK05DMYlDiz3w.text: This is fresh pasta with awesome sauce and great prices.    I will cater soon, but we love the take out.

cLt3UKlisrbp8PSxxZfUoQ.text: Came for lunch after getting a menu placed on my car. I feel the food was right in line with price. Great little corner restaurant with exceptional food. Pasta was hot and delicious. Staff was friendly and prompt. I'm a stickler for good service and they took care of everything. I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This plate of pasta was so amazing. I can&#39;t say I have had &#34;Bigoli&#34; but I know that I like it!

6Z7lOs7rDrQZtm9HAsNA5Q.text: Passing through Vegas, we new we wanted Italian but off the strip. Soooooo Good!!!! They make their own noodles and sauces daily. The macaroni with mushrooms and pancetta was magical! I wish that I lived closer because they deliver! Very friendly staff!

ojnOITyQDBp5-6K1Ao6yzQ.text: I am very picky when it comes to Italian food. Being Italian myself, I thought I couldn't get any better than my moms cooking. After being forced to come here by my parents, I couldn't believe how good it was. I had the butternut squash filled ravioli and it was amazing. I was shocked when I found out that the owners were from Italy and made their own pasta. It really shows in their cooking. This is the only Italian food I actually enjoy eating out. I really hope they get a bigger location in the future! I'll keep coming back regardless.

n_Kw97x_LBFes71KUoaFmA.text: This place is soooo good! As someone who comes from a long line of Italians who make awesome Italian food, I can say this was some delicious pasta! My pappardelle was cooked to perfection! The bruschetta that came with the meal was delicious as well.     As some have stated, the place is very small (though it's next to a currently vacant space, so maybe we'll get lucky and they'll expand?). The atmosphere is nice. A little cozy due to the small space, but quite fresh/modern in appearance. Reminded me a lot of the pasta pomodoro near good ol' SCU.      Food was wonderful, although the lunch special could use a bit of work business strategy-wise. It would have been nice for our gluten-free member of they had included it as an option, even if it came at a dollar or so up-charge. It would have been nice if they included some more of the sauces at an up charge as well.      Price-wise it was a little on the expensive side, since we all ordered non-lunch special items. However, the quality and portions of food, along with the bruschetta was totally worth the price.     Last bit, I had the ice tea to drink, and it was quite different than what I'm used to getting at a restaurant. It had a coffee-ish undertone that was surprisingly pleasant!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free bruschetta with meal!
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle Carbonara! Soooo good! Just ask for some extra pepper and they&#39;ll bring it if you need an extra kick.

DGoq_Fq_eitgIGNTUsihOg.text: This is my absolute favorite place to eat! I can never get enough of it and everything always tastes amazing. Definitely worth the price every time! My favorite is the gnocchi with pink vodka sauce!

XxDoqRGgDtVN8j31_xB8Rw.text: Fresh Pasta, great prices, and friendly servers. This place is my favorite Italian place in town!

n8HeffxVUYHrkx3o-gwW8A.text: Great little spot for pasta. Cooked fresh to order and with fresh ingredients and pasta, it's a better value than Olive Garden. The owner was very nice and gave me a coupon for next time. I'll be back to try their other sauces and pastas

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pesto Alfredo with chicken and fettuccini

MUMEX-wSB12rwyOMq64C5w.text: Super disappointed with this place. I got the butternut squash ravioli with Carbonara. $17 and I got EIGHT raviolis. I wasn't crazy about the flavor and it was way to greasy. Definitely won't be coming back.

j4zsrINDwyBYtPF3aMvmxg.text: OH MY PASTA! I can't boast enough about this place! It really is the best pasta I have had, and I come from a house of Italians and chefs! Every single dish was amazing and the service was great! It's a smaller place, which I actually love - more of a quiet "homey" feel.   We had 3 different meals:  Spaghetti with meat sauce - DELICIOUS! The meat sauce is extremely hearty and flavorful  Pappardelle with pink diablo sauce - HOLY CRAP. It has just the perfect amount of kick to it and the pasta was perfectly cooked  Spinach ravioli with liguria sauce - BASIL BASIL BASIL! I've never had a pesto sauce more fresh than theirs - we got this dish without chicken to accommodate our vegetarian of the group which was good to know any sauce can be made without meat - all cooked TO ORDER.  Nutella cheesecake for dessert, need I say more?  I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this place to every foodie and pasta lover!

Great selection to choose from. Everything we had was delicious! Our service was fantastic. The hardest thing is just trying to decide! I had the bigoli pasta with meat sauce and meat balls. My husband had the gnocchi with meat sauce. We got the cheese cake to go for dessert!

di9YravWBR_QikfW569etQ.text: This place was amazing. I would never have gone in here on my own but the reviews were so high and the pictures so delicious looking...I'm so glad we went in. Decided to take someone that would normally go to a Nobu or Fleming's and they were blown away by this humble establishment. Make sure you try it yourself!

qjeJwYPYvae4ARcxK6d8dQ.text: Had lunch here as I was in town for work, cute little shop and I felt welcomed as soon as I walked in. They really took care of me, greeted me and had a Sprite in my hands before I had time to think. I asked what the meat sauce was like and they gave me a sample of it to try it before ordering. ic3CrONDjXCKcvqIZAGt6Q.text: I was extremely craving pasta one night, and searched apple maps for "pasta near me," and Pastaidea popped up! My girlfriend and I decided to give it a try. When we went, we were immediately offered a menu, and thought it was so unique how one picks their choice of pasta first, then sauce. The different sauces blew our mind, as we didn't know that many different sauces existed! Then, we enjoyed it so much, we went back three days later to try another sauce! The customer service was impeccable, as our food was prepared at the perfect time! Once the food was served, it was a quiet dinner. You know when something tastes SO good, you and the person you're with are completely silent, just enjoying EVERY bite of the food. We will most definitely be back soon!

wirQ7TzyH_0wZCgFoC_Siw.text: Avoid this place.  New ownership, and the amazing food left with the old owners.  Update: There is so much more to running a restaurant than making the food. L-FSxJ6B1Fvk0HeYJW4U5g.text: It's a small, locally owned spot with freshly made pastas that far surpass what can be found at Buca di Peppo a couple blocks down. Pastas are made fresh every morning and the flavors and execution are better than what can be found at most sit down establishments off the Strip. There hasn't been much buzz about this spot, but it's a restaurant worth checking out. While small, it's good for families and a quick bite.  Check the board for daily specials, like the fettuccine diablo ($14) full of bold flavored sausages, pepperoni, pepper and sundries tomatoes lightly covered in a pink vodka sauce. Their menu has a list of specialty pastas, as well. One is baked butternut squash ravioli ($14.95), with equal amounts of sweetness and savoriness and covered in a layer of blistered cheese.   You can build your own pasta dishes, but their pricing structure is a little awkward. You choose your pasta (there are over a dozen options priced between $4 and $10 each), then choose your sauce (over 3 dozen types from $4 to $12). I loved the pesto gorgonzola, but the gnocchi I paired it with was rather thick and dense.   Created by the same people responsible for Spaghetti Western in Southern Highlands, this tiny spot has quickly gained in popularity despite lacking in marketing. But, judging from the crowds that constantly fill their tables, locals are already aware of this gem.

wsdRJfur1jauceDtC0ohkA.text: Hummm Ok I see with all the reviews here that only one other person had a problem with the menu at Pastaidea. But something is wrong here.  My friend and I went for lunch today and you need to beware that the  "choose a Noodle" means you are paying a separate amount for whatever noodle you choose like my friend picked the Mushroom Ravioli which was $7.45 just for the pasta.  Then you choose a sauce , well she choose Spicy Marinara which added a whopping $9.75 for a "Marinara Sauce" to the total for her dish which made the dish cost a whopping $17.20 for a fast lunch in a basically a fast food place.  Now I can understand paying that sort of price for a fabulous plate of pasta at a higher end "real" Restaurant but not a small little 5 table and little metal chairs joint with no bar, in the back of a strip mall.  Thank God she didn't order a side salad also add another $6.70 or God forbid she ordered the Carbonara Sauce $ 10.45 or the Veneto Sauce (Asparagus, grape, mushroom & Prosciutto Crudo) for 11.45 extra charge which would have made Mushroom Ravioli and Asparagus sauce total $18.90. They also freeze their pasta and sauce. Pastaidea  you need to look at high end great restaurants with seasoned famous Chef's prices: Sauce included with the Pasta: WOLFGANG PUCK'S in Summerlin =Orecchiette with Sausage=$17.00, Spaghetti AND Meatballs+ $18.00 NORTH ITALIA in Summerlin=Spaghetti AND Meatballs also at $17.00, Bolognese meat sauce $18.00, Strozzapreti (my fav) has fresh Chicken, roasted Mushrooms, Spinach, Toasted Pine Nuts and Fresh Parmesan cream sauce= $18.00 MARCHE BACCHUS FRENCH BISTRO in Las Vegas= Veal Ragu Pappardelle $18.00 So I say POO POO ON PASTAIDEA, not a great idea!

They mostly have different types of pasta and meats that you pair with sauces and they have a ton of different sauces. It's about the same price as like Olive Garden but better. My dinner was $15 but I get at least two meals out of it. Maybe even a third small meal. The staff was super nice. ZqUgyAcvQhap_BeLB-YcJg.text: Came here not really knowing what to expect because a friend of mine stated she wasn't really a fan. But I was optimistic and gave them a try.      I came with a group of 5 and we order the meatball appetizer, two orders of the chicken parmesan with alfredo sauce both with fettuccine, the garlic lovers with fettuccine, the pesto gorganzola with spaghetti and the campania with cheese raviolis.  The meatball app was very tasty and we also received complimentary bread which was crusty and delicious.      It look a little longer than I expected to receive the food, but it was worth the wait. The plates themselves had very generous portions. I ordered the garlic lovers and it was pretty good, although I thought it could have had a stronger garlic flavor. The only problem was that I ordered it with fettuccine and it came with a thick spaghetti. I do not like spaghetti but I didn't want to make a big deal about it so I just started eating but they also messed up on the pesto plate with instead of spaghetti they put fettuccine. I tried some of the chicken parmesan, the flavor was there but the chicken was a little dry. The staff was nice and the only other complaint I would have was the the sodas tasted a little watered down. Overall it was pretty good experience and I would come back to try some of their different flavors.

BAw5_J2F2zltHV50WkQaig.text: I give this place 1 star not for the food, but for the service. My husband and I have ordered from them multiple times. On our most recent visit we ordered a to go order. My husband asked for Parmesan and red peppers to go. We were told it was 80 cents each for the Parmesan and red peppers even though they have Parmesan and red peppers on the table for the customers who eat there. The money isn't the issue however when we order a $20 pasta entree parmesan and red peppers are normally standard at any Italian restaurant, even pizza places for that matter. If they are that that cheap with their condiments it makes me wonder what other corners are they cutting in the kitchen. It's a shame because we stay around the corner from This establishment and actually enjoyed their food however they have a lost a customer for life.

y1PbzTdjjLSAP8_98GS4jw.text: When I stopped by this place the other night, it was packed and had a 40 minute wait time- so I decided to try it Today for lunch instead. To finally find a place that offers homemade pasta; I couldn't pass it up! I would have given it 5 Stars, however my first impression/ the order I received was not 5 star quality. I spent $27 *Tip not included* for a Chicken Parmigiana Entree, Pasta E Fajioli soup and a Drink; so it was a bit pricy. (Don't get me wrong, the food was on point and the flavors / quality of ingredients met my expectations), but there were definitely some shortcomings. To start off, when I order a $7 bowl of soup, I expect it to be a $7 bowl of soup! Instead, I received a soup which was only 1/2 way filled. It almost gave me the impression that they ran out, and instead of just telling me- they simply poured what they had left in a container and called it a day. The pasta in the soup was Al Dente, so it was done right. It wasn't over salted or anything... it was just half way to the top- which was not a $7 bowl of soup in my eyes. The Chicken Parmigiana was just that- Chicken Parm. The portion size was plenty, so the $16 price tag was well justified. The sauce was perfect / the Pasta was cooked to perfection, and it was piping hot, so no complaints there. Now the soda... I'm pretty sure their machine ran out of carbonation- so I received a Flat Soda, so I had to purchase one from the work-room vending machine for my lunch- I shouldn't have had to do that, but it's life. Had I received the full order / portion of soup that I paid for and a the cold Pepsi I expected, my experience would have had been different, but it's the little things like that which ruin someone's first impression. I will likely try this place again, but I won't make the mistake of assuming the order was done right.

9lCI-ygbNOh3Le_7bqyeQw.text: Went with a friend who loves this place. Swears by the mushroom ravioli.   I had their GF fettuccine. It was carelessly cooked (noodles stuck together like if you don't stir them), and a little more al dente than I'd have liked. Flavor was subpar, consistency was a little odd....it was somehow both undercooked and falling apart. Barilla does it better.   Also, they served a breadstick with my GF pasta. *eye roll* If I were more severely averse to wheat I'd have sent it back.   The rest of it was good though, and service was friendly if a bit hard to track down to get condiments and refills of water. I'd come back, but I would choose to suffer for a day or so in order to have their regular pasta.  3-stars until more data points exist.

S_tEj5uKauFQaEg-Q_m1qg.text: Bigoli noodles. It's what you'd imagine would come out of a Play Doh fun factory. In a good way. The pasta has a great texture which clings to sauce and a wonderful bite. The pink Capania sauce was delish. Lots of sun dried tomatoes, very well seasoned, and served HOT and fresh. Service warm and friendly. I look forward to coming back and trying more pasta/sauce combos. The menu is extensive and given 20+ pastas and even more sauces the options are endless. Plus I saw ravioli, lasagne and other baked dishes as well as dessert on the menu.
