l2Qg-_txM8fpDyrKpYvPhw.text: Ok let me say I have gone at least ten times in the past and loved this place.  My wife and I went last night and sat at the little counter by the bathroom.  Not the most appetizing spot but we were ok with it.  They literally had 6 tables with us (1 big combined table) and 3 waitresses.  No one talked or looked at us for 15 minutes.  No menu, nothing.  Young kid came over and said it was his first Saturday shift and apologized.  No problem!  He took our order immediately, still no menus, but we knew what we wanted.  Brought us drinks and free garlic bread.  Fast forward one hour later still no food.  Remember 6 tables and 3 servers.  2 tables had come in after us and were DONE eating.  I finally said something and server said it will be right out.  5 minutes later another server comes out and told me they had no more gnocchi left, do I want to order something else.  I was furious told them no and wanted to talk to the manager.  They said the owner is out in the kitchen and he will be right out to explain.  Waited 3 minutes staring at owner and he never came out.  Left and will never go back.  Just read post about new owner and that explains everything.  That sucks cause this was my favorite pasta.  It will be closed in one year, damn.  44 years old and I have never written a negative review, so disappointed.

I read some of the other reviews and I was also put off by the fact that the owner will respond to other peoples yelp reviews in a very rude and defense of tone rather than having a genuine interest in improving the place and catering to the customers.  I think that says a whole lot about the place.

W3q2Fq51mxtYNwvod80HKA.text: Friends of my wife told us of this place so we decided to give it a try. When we got there it was not crowded so we grabbed a table. Looked at the menu and knew what we wanted. So we waited for someone to take our order. About a 10 to 15 minute wait. My wife said if no one comes in a few minutes we would leave. Finally the waitress came over and took our order. Two waters and two drinks. She left and came back with some bread ( three slices for two people ! ) it was not crisp but very soggy. She came back with the waters and one drink and had to go back for the other. While we were waiting for our food we watched what was going on. The waitress messed up the order on the table next to us, and the other person working there came over to our table with someone else's order. This happened a few more times with others orders. It was like they could not remember who got what. Got our food finally, wife got the  Bigoli noodles with meat sauce which she said noodles were a little chewy and sauce not tasty. I got the regular noodles with meat sauce and meat balls, noodles a little chewy and sauce seemed ok but different then the meat sauce my wife got. Meatballs were small and not very tasty. Food was not very hot when served to us. So we tried it and will not got back because of service, taste and price. All items are al carte which adds up.  We will stick going to Mezzo Bistro which is about same price or cheaper and the meatballs are the size of a baseball and has good service and larger tables.

QNi3RpY1pqoNKU_tCDAeaA.text: We stumbled upon Pasta Idea quite by accident and am so glad we did. The staff was inviting and friendly. We ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce with some trepidation as meat sauce can often be a hit or a miss. It was a big hit and absolutely delicious. You could tell upon first bite the pasta was fresh and homemade. I ordered a single order but the portion was large enough for two people. The fresh Bruschetta was very flavorful and was the perfect compliment to the pasta. We  will be returning here often.

A6ky_mmpadV8OSj-Cxm78Q.text: The service is friendly but they are still trying to figure out service and how to handle a lunch rush. I had the pasta with meat sauce. It was okay and rather oily. The wife really enjoyed her spinach ravioli. The garlic bread was good and included in the meal.

w-2nfc_gJwtxbvT2KOhhqw.text: Pleasantly surprised! The food was awesome, it was fresh and you could taste the quality! Service is excellent, well worth it. And it doesn't show it on the menu but you can buy their uncooked fresh pasta and take it home to cook yourself! My only complaint about the restaurant were there chairs. It sounds like a petty complaint until you have to sit in one of them, they are truly the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever sat in. I will definitely be going back often!

s22TciiJAXbckkPxC6fj9w.text: This pasta shop ONLY got three stars because of their cleanliness and customer service was awesome.   The food was so tasteless; I couldn't even finish it. I ordered pasta with meat sauce because the cashier told me it was her favorite. So I thought to myself, 'Huh, meat sauce is a good place to start. It's tomatoes, meat, and seasoning, so it can't taste bad.'   Wrong. So wrong.   The meat sauce had no flavorful herbs; it BARELY tasted like salt and a passing breeze of one pungent herb that is simply indescribable. The sauce had almost no meat, and was so watered down that I couldn't even taste the tomatoes.   The noodles were fresh, yes, but again, there was no flavor to help them along in the meal.   My bread was burnt on one side, tasted mostly like butter (a twinge of garlic flavor). The best thing about the entire meal were the tomatoes in the bruschetta. The topping itself tasted sour, but the sweetness of the tomatoes saved it.   I would've rather spent my $12 at Olive Garden.  needless to say; I won't be coming back.

btYKk64tyiSWpuLmY3yKjQ.text: Great find! Tucked back in a corner, but super friendly staff. Food was fresh, excellent and cooked to perfection. Highly recommend this place for your pasta desires. I wish they had more locations throughout the valley. This one is not close to us, but while visiting family and decided to grab a bite. Very glad we chose PastaIdea.  Well, here I am 5 days later with high hopes and everything was a complete 180 from last time. The service was awful. We were a party of 2 and there were 2 other tables seated in the restaurant. It seemed to take forever to have our orders taken. The food didn't seem nearly as fresh as it came out only moments after ordering, telling me the prepared dishes were simply heated up before being delivered to our table. After dinner I pointed out, to the very impersonal  waitress our displeasure in our meal. She seemed to have many excuses as to why the service was poor, such as "the other waitress is new", "it's our busiest time and we don't make enough money to have an extra waitress here for 8 hours when we're only busy for a couple hours" or "we had several phone orders coming in for pick up or delivery." This experience has brought my 5 star review quickly to a 2 star review. Will not be returning.

I don't know if this is new ownership, but they didn't seem to know the menu well.  I'm vegetarian, so I usually get something a bit more customized, like a certain sauce, but without the meat.  In the past, they have been super accommodating and suggested which things might pair the best.  We ordered two dishes and wanted them spicy.  Took our food to go. That's great that you have a family business, family restaurant, but if we were dining in, that's a big turn-off in terms of ambiance. 3ZybUeU1hFE6tkAeq-Abpg.text: This place is definitely one of the best restaurants you will find when in search of fresh pasta and fresh ingredients while still remaining True to authentic Italian flavor.  Being a Las Vegas native, born and raised, I figured this place was going to be just like every other Italian place. Needless to say, my husband and I were pleasantly surprised.   We were greeted almost immediately and seated with drinks served shortly after. Our two year old child was accompanying us, and he was offered crayons and a coloring paper to keep him occupied.   Fresh bruschetta was served immediately following. The bread itself was fresh out of the oven with a crisp golden color on the outside, and the soft, warm texture in the middle of a perfectly baked bread. The bread itself had been delicately brushed over the top with a mixture of olive oil, fresh Italian herbs, and a hint of parmesan. The herbs were so fresh that you could tell they came immediately off of the plant as they lacked that crispy, dried texture of herbs that are obtained from the store or bottled herbs. The tomato mixture of the bruschetta was served in a small separate bowl instead of on top of the bread like other restaurants serve it which prevented the bread from getting soggy. The tomato bruschetta mixture contained the same fresh herbs. The tomatoes themselves were fresh, crisp, and slightly sweet in taste. The combination of both complimented each other perfectly.  I ordered the chicken parmigiana. The chicken itself was of a high quality, tender cut with absolutely no fat or grisly pieces, evenly coated, topped with a baked mozzarella cheese blend over the top, slightly golden brown. When you cut into it, the melted cheese mixed with the perfect amount of crispy batter over the chicken was enough to keep your mouth watering. The combination of the marinara sauce set this dish over the top of any competitor. My grandfather is from Sicily, and this was the only sauce I have ever tasted in comparison to his. In Italy, the people will ONLY pick and use what is in season. It has to be perfect, and this chef chose the perfect seasonal tomato to make a fresh, sweet, marinara sauce that you can only find here. Every Italian recipe for sauce is different, but I found this one to be most like my grandfather's which will always be my favorite. Since he is no longer around, this is definitely my new Italian go to spot for pasta!  The taste of authentic Italian food differs greatly from the Americanized marinara sauces you'll find at Olive Garden chain type Italian restaurants which is why some may not like the taste, but this is authentic Italian food. For those of you who are Italian, that is hard to come by now days.  If this isn't enough to get you to visit, my husband is a fine dining chef who has worked at both the Wynn and the Paris. He has also worked in the presence of Chef Gordon Ramsay. At times I get irritated because my husband is one of the most critical, pickiest, worst people to take to restaurants because he's such a foodie snob. Even he liked the food. His only complaint was that he thought the shrimp was slightly undercooked, but enjoyed his meal (fettuccine with shrimp alfredo sauce) very much which is a huge compliment coming from him! Lol

myt_CJhAUfI8Hu9WffOq8g.text: Chicken fettuccine, butternut squash, tortellini with marinara and fettuccine with vodka sauce and all were amazing! Excellent service too.

QG5hf8fUFkmBI3ddGKILGw.text: This place is awesome. Some of my wife's friends had told her about it. We had been meaning to go for a while. Finally went last night. This is not a chain. This is a one off location owned by a guy who just came over from Italy. He hand makes his pasta each day. That's why everyone is raving over it. I don't even know what to say other than it was AMAZING. The service was great. Our server was super friendly. We were there until they closed. So she went home and the owner closed us out. Cool guy. A little hard to understand him actually because he still has a super strong accent and his English isn't so great.   This place will be in our regular rotation of places to eat for sure.   And yes the portions are good size (not huge though) and yeah the seating options are limited. Oh well. Some of the best places I've ever eaten were small cramped places.

6nUc5ctGXebS3QCT0KK80g.text: So this is a little hole in the wall restaurant. It's not very spacious at all and the decor isn't exactly welcoming. However, if you're looking for highly priced take out, this is it! They do deliveries also. Now, don't get me wrong, Pasta Idea has some pretty good eats but it's not the kind of place you bring your family to if you're on a budget. It's quite expensive for a place like this, but the food is tasty (I'm a sucker for garlic bread & I loved theirs)! I had bigoli pasta with the pink diablo sauce. It was very good - although I'll probably get something less spicy next time. The lasagna was on their "favorites" menu, but I've had better. It was mostly pasta and very minimal meat sauce. The meat sauce is tasty, though, I must admit. If you feel like splurging on a meal one day, by all means check this place out. But if you're looking for food on a budget, pasta idea is not for you.

IDPzAg6jd-jj2M8EEP_o2g.text: This place is amazing! A friend of mine recommended it since I've been trying to find a good pasta place and this definitely hit the spot. I went w a few of my girlfriends and we all got completely different platters and all of the were amazing. I got the mushroom stuffed ravioli w carbonara sauce and it was delicious. Definitely a heavy duo but if you don't mind, it was amazing. The place was quite small but I called and made reservations and we were fine!

nzYuE7_87_HL8-ThsBCJKQ.text: My ex boyfriend (6"2,230pounds,never leaves food on the table) and I had to take a doggie bags! Such huge portions, perfectly cooked, and very flavorful.  Tried once we saw on Yelp. Many people there were trying for the first time as well and we overheard comments they were just as happy.   I had spaghetti and Alfredo, he had pink Diablo. Garlic bread and tomato salad comes with meal- really good.  One less start then perfect ONLY because of the seating/table/limited space. It's kinda cramped and I'm pretty sure I sat on a patio chair inside!

nMBc14pnhao2P6PvO7QbHw.text: Saw this place on yelp and gave it a whirl. Me and family showed up on a Sunday around 530. Very small place only like 5 tables. It was our first time there so, thankfully we got a seat cause I guess people call ahead and reserve tables. Service was a little slow, they had one waitress and all the tables got filled up all at once. Took awhile for them to take our ordered, seemed a little unorganized. Once we finally ordered, the food came out and wow amazing flavor and huge portions. We ordered mushroom raviolis with Red Diablo sauce & chicken parm. Finally a place who knows good pasta. The garlic bread amazing which is complimentary when you dine in. I bought cannolis to take home. Those were just pooas amazing crunchy and so fresh. Done right. Can't wait to go back and try this place. Prolly will order and take home, seems a little too stressful to get in there and get a spot. Hopefully a bigger place will come soon, but totally understand the concept. Will be back gonna try some of the white sauces next time.

Xkjnk42DFg1JdKppp0w6Dg.text: this is about a very key member of your team...as i have not had the pleasure of enjoying your pasta, but will this week........ wantt to compliment one of your staff.   i am an uber driver.   picked up this young man and took him and his friend downtown last night.   we got to chatting and i asked him what he does....and he was so very proud to tell me about pasta idea, which is a place i have on my list but not yet visited.   this young man is all about customer service on and off the clock.  i praised him for that.    he could not stop complimenting the chef and the skills the chef has and how much the chef enjoys cooking for his customers.  this young man had me wanting to turn around to come to your restaurant at that moment....i will be there in the coming weeks for sure....  want you to know that i personally feel that you are so very blessed to have such an energetic young man on your team.  he is golden for you and your team.    i think that we all know it is so rare these days to find someone to hire that meets ones expectation, much less exceeds them as this young man obviously does.  i did not catch his name, but he is a taller thin young man.  you and your store are very very blessed to have him inside and outside of your doors.  i look forward to my first meal at pasta idea

A4owJT0zSuwhhFAlHQ0R0w.text: Never again. Between the inedible lasagna and rude staff, I'm done. We used to really like this place. But recently service and food quality has deteriorated. Tonight we ordered to go and by the time I got home (10 minutes to first bite) the food was ice cold. When I arrived I was the only guest there with 3-4 people behind the counter. The girl behind the register only acknowledged me when I finally asked her "am I talking to myself?" to which she responded "it's $33". NhHngQHbAafub6FxBc8Eug.text: Best thing to order through UberEats and the like. So filling and satisfying. Pasta on steroids, YUM!!

Unke6pfUyl020G-sFg4lQg.text: If you are going to order for delivery please read this review.  I have read down further and it looks like this happens often.  We ordered through Uber Eats at 7:25 on a friday night.  I knew it would take a while so it said 8:10 and I was very prepared to wait.  At 8:20 I called and they said that they had the order but that a group of 12 had come in and they were behind.  I said okay.  They said it would be out the door soon.  At 8:45 I called again (they closed at 9) and they assured me it was still coming and said that they had soccer teams come in but would throw in a free bread.   Our Uber driver came at 9:10 and I felt so bad for her because she had been waiting at Pastaidea for 1 1/2 hours for our order to deliver it.  I gave her a $15 tip.  When I got inside our order was missing 1 entire dish, 1 fountain drink, and the bottled drink was the wrong kind.  I called Pastaidea for the 3rd time and the person answering the phone listened to what was wrong and told me he was going to get the manager.  I waited on hold for 16 minutes and then they hung up on me without ever coming back on the line.  I called back and they answered and hung up on me.  I called again and a female answered.  I again explained what was missing and she stated they would take my name and number and I could come in for a free entree.  The time and the missing food was one issue, but the unprofessionalism by Pastaidea to correct the situation is why I am typing this.  I asked that the manager call me tomorrow.  I will update this review if I hear from anyone from the restaurant.  The food we got was great, lukewarm but great as always.  If you want to eat there DINE IN.

41JfnWCkcpcne7BgmPtg3Q.text: I arrived at hotel, jet lagged and exhausted. I ordered meal online for delivery. I received a confirmation no and email confirmation. It was up to 2 hr for delivery. About minute 50 I called to see how close they were to being able to deliver.  She said the order had not yet been processed...  she offered to " really put order in " and wait another hour. No thanks. Cancelled order. Called aces and ales. Got a salad and burger within 20 minutes .. deliver is not their strength it seems by reviews

a4SBpLf-rNYVXC72qqQq7w.text: Poor poor customer service.  615p Takeout order placed for 645 pickup.  Order was accepted and confirmed.  640p arrive and they say that it will be ready soon. Cool, thanks for the info. Note: 3 tables: 1 finishing, 1 mid-meal, and 1 waiting for entrees.  7p last table gets entrees, still no food. Walk inside to check they said it will be ready soon. New couple sits down.  710p new couple gets entrees, still no food. T walks inside to complain and I call yelp customer service.  715p All they offered was an effin free dessert for the wait. No apologies, nothing. GTFOH!  I'm sorry, but a dessert does not make-up for the fact that you knowingly made the entrees for the people who came in after us.  How the F do you expedite an order that comes in at 7p over a prepaid takeout order that comes in at 615p for 645p with the customer waiting.....  The older woman server barely acknowledged us. The younger man behind between the counter and the kitchen has no clue and kept saying it was coming. Kitchen was a joke.   Whoever the owner of this place is seriously needs to train his staff or shut this place down.  Utterly disppointing.  Good news, saved myself $40 for overpriced pasta.  Don't waste your time.

Evb3g48hvHuLRyuHUtyuDA.text: Warning when placing a Togo order be prepared to not receiving it and be ignore.   Big mistake Pastaidea, as I would had been a repeat customer. I love pasta!   Our order was place and we showed up five minutes earlier to let them know we were here. They tell us it's coming. We wait another 10 minutes after our pick up time. We ask them what's going on with our order, guess what they say "it's coming." We wait some more . No acknowledgement from the people in the restaurant on our order, so I patiently wait to give them a chance 2 couples come in at this point that have been seated and it's 35 min wait now . gtSxozWNlAN2P7fVIFkLlw.text: Free bruschetta, I wasn't excepting that all.  I think all Italian restaurant should do free bruschetta.  Most Mexican restaurant do free chips makes sense to me.  Any ways. I been wanting to trying this Pastaidea place for a month. North Italia got in the way last week but was able to stop here for lunch yesterday. YorvYgYwlR_Q-5vxGLHTJg.text: What a hidden gem! Service was super friendly and accommodating and food was great! Portions are HUGE and they are really generous with garlic bread and drink refills. Garlic bread is really good by the way.   They offer many varieties of fresh made pasta and let you pick the sauce you want. There are about 40 sauces to pick from. They can even customize. For example, I wanted the Amatriciana but on the menu it said that it was spicy but they are able to make it mild. The table next to us ask for no cream in one of the sauces and they were able to accommodate that as well.   The baked butternut squash ravioli was recommended to us and it was amazing. The filling was smooth and creamy with just a hint of sweetness. I would go back just for that!  Chicken parmigiana was good too. The spaghetti that came with it was delicious!  We didn't know how big the portions are so ended up ordering a 3rd dish for the 2 of us. Bigoli with Amatriciana sauce. You can probably guess we weren't able to finish and had tons of left overs which they were really kind to pack up for us as well.  Wonderful service, delicious fresh made pastas. Will be back soon!

ZA_dUEWitEMBUanEhmCUwg.text: Love this place! pasta is fresh and the servers are  friendly. I love coming to this place, they have an awesome selection of pastas...fresh pasta noodles. Better than most expensive restaurants. My to go place in Nevada.

fhdjX1dWTUKvkyzeAJ3zdg.text: Nice couple running the restaurant. Really good pastas. Had the pesto creamy sauce, the chicken Marsala and ravioli. All really well done and pasta taste pretty fresh. The complimentary bruschetta is really lovely too. Would definitely go back.

MkZG-eNgn9iT2cb3TPht1w.text: Hands down best Italian in town.  I have eaten here over 10 times already. I have also brought over 10 new people here. It has been a perfect experience every single time. The chicken cacciatore tastes like heaven. The lasagna is also great (hard to find good lasagna)! Garlic lover is another amazing sauce. Best pasta - made in the restaurant daily - many choices. You seriously can't go wrong except for gaining weight ;)

TePnl1SKjDYCLxffKMIV9A.text: This place amazing, from the very sweet girl named Idalia that took our orders, answered all the questions and gave amazing recommendations. The bread and tomatoe thing they bring out is to die for!

pLubF6H0rvwTZiG4wQ_PzQ.text: We stopped in here for takeout the other night and it was an "interesting" experience. We had searched for pasta before we left the house and this place was close so we decided to try it. What we didn't realize is that it is located in a little strip mall and only has about 5 tables. Whatever, not a big deal.   They were very crowded when we stopped in and so we decided to take it to-go. One of their employees was pushing tables together to make room for a large group and she just about bowled us over. She was very gruff and didn't seem to be thinking of customer service.   On the other hand, the lady at the counter was very nice and explained that you started by picking a pasta, then adding a sauce, then adding toppings. That sounded okay until I realized that just the pasta was going to be $4-$8 and then it was going to be another $4-11 to add sauce, and even more money to add toppings. For a tiny little restaurant, the price added up fast. Nevertheless, we went ahead an ordered. It came to about $65 (not including tip) for 3 people. We waited outside on one of the patio tables for them to bring out our food. That was nice.   When we got home though, we weren't amazed by the quality. Yes, the noodles were obviously made fresh and that was great, but the sauces were just "meh." Of our three dishes, the plain pasta alfredo was definitely the best, and I'd probably come back just to order that. However, the other two weren't great. The red meat sauce was watery and could have used some parmesan cheese on top. Similarly, my boyfriend got some sort of pasta with sausage and he said it was just "okay." We also shared an order of the chicken tortellini soup and it was very oniony, and that's coming from someone who absolutely loves onions. Had the entire meal not been so expensive, it probably wouldn't have been an issue, but I honestly expected more for what we paid. So while it's not a bad place to eat, it just wasn't quite what I was expecting for $20 a person.

E8nqydXBy7cpUwOVA0AnWg.text: My husband and I saw the reviews for Pastaidea and decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did. The food was outstanding. The service was impeccable. We ordered the prosciutto appetizer. Delicious. My husband ordered the spaghetti carbonara and I had chicken Parmesan and cheese ravioli. The portions are huge, the homemade pastas were cooked perfectly and the sauces were delicious. My chicken was expertly friend and had just the right amount of cheese.  I took home more than half of my meal. We ordered tiramisu and cannoli to go. Both wee mouthwatering. We will eat here again, and again.  Update 3/2. This time we ordered to carry out. My husband couldn't get enough of the carbonara, so he ordered that again. Delicious.  I had the diablo pink sauce.  Just as delicious.  Portions are huge.  I ate what was left of mine for lunch the next day.  We will come again and again.

fzAHAEvmxufI6cAgSlFS-A.text: (Update) I don't know what has changed, but the quality isn't as good. I would have gladly paid more to keep it as it was. The flavor isn't as rich and well-rounded as it was when I first started going here. And the garlic bread isn't as good. I hope they bounce back. I want this place to stick around and be a quality go-to for pasta. I will go back in hopes it improves. I haven't been in a while because I've been a little disappointed more than a couple of times.  (Original Review) Pasta made fresh and delicious!  Amazing sauces. Small and intimate, yet casual restaurant/ cafe. Specials every day. A few casual desserts to choose from. The people are warm and welcoming. Espresso to finish it off. No alcohol. This is quite literally my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I always introduce good friends to this place, and bring dates I want to impress with good food and a friendly atmosphere. Hometown feel type restaurant in cafe environment in the big city where everything else is over the top and impersonal. A must-stop for top quality pasta.

RzgXiGas2wg4VgksCBAsUg.text: The young female that worked the register in August of 2018 was incredibly rude and disrespectful.  I was appalled at the attitude displayed and complete lack of professionalism - not to mention lack of common sense.  She was mouthy and confrontational and then the men there "came to her rescue" by removing the person she was attacking.  Not exactly good business practice to hire rude and disrespectful employees.  I'd never eat there based on principle.  Never could the food be worth dealing with that.

M_vLI1FntW-0Yjzmu0qWCA.text: Our family has loved Pasta Idea since it opened..Something is very wrong with management and/or help. Placed an order one evening, no lasagna, no butternut filled ravioli (really, you are a Italian restaurant). Thought we would try on the weekend (for sure plenty of entrees), no lasagna again... Went to pick up the order after a designated 30 minute wait only to be told the order wasn't placed yet. I am disappointed. Way too many good restaurants in the Northwest area to be treated with lack of care and menu choices.

IjCKpNidc3v-aNH3D0NK3Q.text: Amazing!!!! Simply the BEST pasta in Vegas! The closest thing I've had since traveling to Italy!

V8rXtHa3Qkpf6YTq0NX-7g.text: I am never going back but if I ever did I would never again pay before my to go order comes out.  Waited for over half an hour after paying for me and my kids food to watch 3 tables come in, look at the menu, order, and receive their food while we stand there waiting.  Over heard the cook say "he can just wait" when asked about my order.  I guess he didn't know I speak Spanish to.  Then I got the run around about wanting a refund because suddenly nobody knows how to do that, pretty sure it was all just a stall tactic till food was complete.  Please others beware.

uCAYXbnlo3BvmJpDAsdRbQ.text: First time here for my late lunch break.  From the reviews, I was expecting some good pasta.  Instead what I got was hella good pasta!  Tried the basic spaghetti alla marinara so I can gauge the taste of simple ingredients.  I know I ate more than I should have, but couldn't help myself.  A side of bruschetta accompanied the pasta - and that disappeared as well.  The place was small and quaint.  Plenty of seat space at 1pm on a Thursday.  The weather was perfect for enjoying next to the open door.  I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.  Can't remember if they had genovese, but definitely would want to try that and the pesto.  Oh, they do have a decent kids menu too.

BNx_4TV4tAe-eC-RamAKcg.text: I found this place via Door Dash and decided to drive to the location and see what all the fuss was about. It's a small local place that has some of the best pasta i've had on the west coast. It's great because it's totally customizable. I had the pink diablo sauce while dining in. It was fantastic. The sausage in the sauce seemed to be high quality. I raved about the place so much we ordered it at work for "Free Lunch Friday". The guys that work for me got Alfredo and I ordered Chicken Parm. Everyone loved this place and asked me for the location so they could go there on their off time. It's seriously a hidden gem of summerlin and I hope they expand to the "deep north" of las vegas so I can go more often.

kafTGe0QxIhU7eeSJnXXgA.text: Heard about this place from a friend, and it's the best Italian food I've had!  The place is very small, only 6 tables. The owner (I think) greeted us right when we walked in, and the place was busy with guests dining in and picking up for takeout.  The decor is nice and clean, you can tell attention to detail is important to the owner. They have a server come to your table rather than order at the counter and sit down. Hunter was our server, very attentive and knowledgeable (thanks!)  Let's get to the food, everything is fresh here. The pasta & sauces are made in house, and delicious! Portions are filling, there's enough to take some home.  The rigatoni with pesto & gorgonzola was flavorful. The cioppino over fettuccine was my favorite, a seafood medley of deliciousness! My only gripe: the snow crab comes with shell, so be ready to get a little dirty :)  I'm so impressed, I wish I didn't live so far from this place. But the drive is definitely worth it, I'll be coming back!

8h3SfUdc9EKzAebN0SD-_Q.text: I'll start by saying that I'm not one to ever write a review I just don't really do that but I have to be honest the experience that I had the first time that I want to this restaurant was very bad my check was close to $23 for one plate of pasta I got the carbonara with the bigoli and add shrimp. 5 pieces of shrimp with shells still on there tails still. gross to pick out of your mouth with a bite of pasta. Add 4.50 for that nonsense. And my pasta was all chopped up to small strands of noodles like it was recycled pasta unused from another dish. I've heard amazing things about this place fresh pasta amazing ingredients but my experience was very bad. Service was good though but I was the only one in the restaurant so eh

Cr0fel1fYS0Y-51l4QAvJQ.text: Excellent pasta with perfectly paired sauces. We came from out of town and almost left because of the strip mall atmosphere, but so glad we gave it a try. Yum!

p_B2mBEJd6wVnLmRwFdoaw.text: I really wa's looking forward to going here! I happen to stumble across it when I was getting my work pants altered in the same complex. I took a menu hone and that first visit there was a nice man there who said his dad makes the pasta fresh in the morning. I was super excited and couldn't wait to tell my Italian husband about this. . Fast forward a month later... we finally made it in. Tuesday October 3  at about  4p.m. Walked in and wasn't greeted . But the young girl who was behind the counter let us know that they do not make their own pasta fresh! We asked her where does it come from? She said she didn't know just some company.?  I hope the owner realizes that we left because of what she said. And she really didn't seemed concerned at all. She just said bye!. I can buy pasta at smith's down the street. I was really disappointed because I was looking forward to what the first guy told me a month prior that they make their own pasta in the a.m  When she said they get it from some company?? She didn't know where I lost my taste for even sitting in this small restaurant .  It isnt the best location .  Very disappointed .

EoDvIOD_-yID6fhTn4Yr8A.text: I read reviews for this place and was so excited to try a place that made fresh, organic pasta. I'm sorry, this place was not good. I mean seriously not good. The reviews are extremely misleading. Which leads me to the conclusion they are all from family members and friends.   We ordered four different dishes and didn't like any of them. Their signature chicken parmigiana had very little taste. The kids Mac and cheese tasted like warm milk and the sauce was about as thin. My son wouldn't touch it. The best dish we had was the pesto pasta with Gorgonzola, it had some good basil flavor but lacked seasoning. We had a little bit of each and then fed the rest to our dog. :( $50 down the drain.   After finding the food to be so lack luster and the reviews not a good representation of said food, I feel taken advantage of, never how you want to feel after eating out. Fool me once, Pasta Idea.

pPYZ1ENcC4HnOQpLKhnZ4g.text: Wow! This place is awesome. It just opened and the food is authentic and delicious. I really can't think of any authentic Italian places besides going down to the strip...   The decor is contemporary and clean. You can tell they take pride in their restaurant. The service was very friendly and everyone there was very nice.  I got the papadelle with campania sauce (a pink sauce with prosciutto, sundried tomatoes and roasted garlic). Literally amazing. The pasta is homemade and fresh and the portion size is generous. They served it with a piece of garlic bread and fresh tomatoes... Um yes please.  Overall, super impressed and really excited to try more things off the menu. Check this place out for sure.

-iv5JjkHAxpXjafxGldKgg.text: The pasta was so fresh and good. Service amazing. Had the pink diablo sauce. I love spicy and this was just the right amount of spicy.

m8IAqsRVtSXkvFlrehuQNg.text: This is a great  place to eat. You get your moneys worth. Pasta  taste really good. People are nice   Jeremiahs was great. Excellent overall experience

CxTuPAASzq37F3yPz-bGRA.text: Our family was visiting from CA and we decided to take them here.  Since this place is so small and we were 6 people  I called and made a reservation.  They have some new things on the menu since the last time we visited the last time.  They serve garlic bread with bruschetta and were happy to give us an additional order when we asked.  We ordered the Prosciutto Crudo and Fresh Mozzarella Appetizer which was delicious.  The portion was enough for 5 of us to share, the prosciutto was exceptional and the cost was very reasonable at $11.45.  We ordered a variety of dishes, Amatriciana (spicy marinara with mixed Italian meats), clams in white wine with angel hair pasta, tricolor cheese tortellini, chicken piccata also with angel hair and ossobucco  which was one of the  specials.  All of our dishes were fantastic and although I did not order the chicken piccata I had the leftovers and it was one of the best I have had.  Every time we visit here we are very happy with the food and the wait staff that are very friendly and helpful.

zXliLZJqGWaBy6CjnCN5Fg.text: Found this place on Yelp when my co-worker and I wanted something delivered at work. Fresh pasta and not one complaint. Other co-workers have followed suit after that and we've ordered here many times after that. We all agree that it's on the pricey side so when the company is paying, Pastaidea it is!   Some issues:  1. Our first time ordering, we asked the driver to bring change and he didn't. So he got a bigger tip than he deserved. I hope that wasn't on purpose...  2. Just recently, we called and specifically said for delivery, they took our cc payment and then told us they don't deliver. We asked for credit back and was told she didn't know how to do that and the manager was already gone. We were too busy at work to pick up our order so we asked for the manger to call us back. The manager ended up arranging someone to deliver our food.   Tips:  * You can pick what kind of pasta you like on and sauce  * They only deliver now through Grubhub

k8BYMOzlG29gRw43yxc3yA.text: Completely wonderful.   I pass this area often and didn't know it existed until a friend told me this afternoon.   We came in and were quickly greeted. We had the option to sit down wherever we wanted. The restaurant is very light and airy. There are several tables, even though the restaurant isn't very large.   We ordered the Chicken alfredo, Carbonara, and hot tea. The meal came with complimentary Bruschetta. All items tasted very good as everything is made fresh. I loved that you get to choose what type of noodle you want with your dish.   Our server was very polite and kept a regular eye on us to make sure we were situated. I got the rest of my food to go and he bagged it up for me.   Would def recommend  Location is Lake Mead/ Buffalo- strip mall type parking.

yKVcOHyY4oCBYa4rjE3v1w.text: Pastaidea is one of the better Italian restaurants in Vegas. I definitely prefer it to other Italian restaurants I've visited in this city. They have a gluten free option among the many types of noodles they hand make. This was one of the major reasons we drove out to this area of Vegas.   The cafe is small but very clean. They have a small area outside that works as a patio if you wish to dine al fresco. I ordered the gluten free fettuccine with Boscaiola, a pink sauce that has speck, peppers, mushrooms, and asparagus. It was very creamy and the vegetables were very tasty. The speck a tad overcooked. The noodles were ok. It's very difficult to get gluten free noodles that are anywhere as good as their gluten filled noodle cousins. These were a bit chewy and stuck to each other. That said, the sauce made up for this.   My friend had spaghetti noodles with Friuli. It looked delicious. They serve complimentary homemade bruschetta. That's a plus.  The server was helpful and polite.  I will be back to try other sauces. I hope they decided to expand their gluten free noodle choices in the future.

5vh2OkFSIMCdhACCBtu9MA.text: Although the food is good they are unreliable. Looked online and website says they are open, drove to the store to locked doors that say we are open and they're open from 11am-9pm but doors were locked, furniture strewn about the restaurant and lights off. This is the second time I've gone to have lunch with my family and have been greeted by nothing but locked doors and no food.

v5KmUhj9LOevTn1zzO7uQQ.text: Found this little gem  last week and so happy we did! It's small, cute and quaint. Menu is pretty standard. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and Garlic lovers pasta. Spaghetti and meatballs: pasta is homemade and so is the sauce. Meatballs were tender and moist. Garlic lovers pasta: amazing! Fettuccini with a white sauce, chicken, broccoli and sun dried tomatoes. They also served a small Plate of bruschetta as an appetizer for no charge. Waitress also told us you can bring your own bottle of wine. We'll definitely be going back soon! Forgot to mention: prices are so friendly. $25 for both dishes and an iced tea.

UsHHJFUPII8hYx3_3UTcEg.text: This is the best Italian(pasta) place in Vegas. I ordered Chicken Marsala with Fettuccine noodles and my fiancee ordered Bigoli noodles with meat sauce. The food smelled great and tasted even better. All the ingredients were fresh. For starters, they gave free bruschetta. I have tried many "Italian" restaurants in las vegas, and I can assure this stands out among them all. The food was just amazing!

VUeD1UQB9El2YCm6Rt6I7Q.text: Such a hidden gem! I had NO IDEA this place existed 5 minutes away from my home and luckily Yelp saved the day. It is a really small establishment with few tables but the service and food was on point! The staff was extremely nice and accommodating without any hesitation.  The way the menu works is you first pick the type of pasta you want and then select the sauce you want -they have it broken down by different categories. Me and my boyfriend got 3 different pastas since it was our first time and we wanted to have a variety of pasta. They market that their pastas are homemade, which I'm not sure if that's True because we didn't witness any hand made pasta. We had the garlic lovers sauce with spaghetti, lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce and fettuccine with meat sauce. They also give complimentary toasted garlic bread and bruschetta. Everything was DELICIOUS and honestly, we were so surprised! We were so impressed with the amount of flavor in all of the different dishes. To make things even better, the portions are huge and it is a major possibility of leftovers. My "serving" fed me 3 times. Pastaidea did not disappoint and I am already thinking of my next dish for next time!

Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli w/ Pink Vodka sauce.

yp2Dkb3jRGmcIKvq2OKzhQ.text: Pastaidea is another hidden gem in town! After seeing it on yelp recommendations for like ever, I decided to give it a try! It's been extremely hard to find good Italian in the neighborhood that I live in, I'm so  happy that we now have Pastaidea.   I ordered takeout two times so far, I will add that the restaurant is pretty tiny inside, but it's super cute! If you do chose to dine in they have a few tables, as well as comfortable seating outside. Obviously if  you're with a larger group this may not be the best option, but if your looking for a bit more intimate setting, yet casual it's a great place to visit.   Last night my boyfriend and I ordered takeout,  I ordered  the butternut squash ravioli with carbonara sauce, and for him the spaghetti with meat sauce, sausage and chicken in it. I can't remember the name of the dish,but he was impressed, we also ordered the chicken tortellini soup, it was amazing!   I was a bit upset about the butternut squash dish, it was pretty much drenched in oil, totally inedible. I'm sure this dish would of been delicious had it not been for the oil, the flavor was great. I did go ahead and  call the restaurant, they were about to close, but the manager handled it wonderfully, as today I stopped in for a replacement meal!   I ended up ordering tonight another order of the chicken tortellini since it was so good, gnocchi with meat sauce which was beyond perfect!! It seriously  tasted like nonna made it! My boyfriend went with  with the chicken  parmigiana, that tasted great as well!   One cool aspect about Pastaidea is the unique concept of the menu, it's very easy to understand. They break down all the different pastas, sauces, and variations of how it could be prepared. They also provide signature dishes. With so many options to chose from there is sure to be something for everyone! I definitely wish they had more locations in town! You can't beat homemade pasta! It could be a little pricey, but the portion sizes are very generous. I'll be back for sure, hopefully to dine in!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She was very helpful!

Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chicken Parm!

HpiJo4CqyyHUEeMFy8Kzyw.text: Let me start off by saying I did not come here for the pasta.  My intent was to order a Caesar salad.  Before I left my house I searched for a place that had great Caesar salads and this place came up.  Upon arriving, the first thing I saw was "handmade noodles" on their restaurant sign.  In the snap of the fingers I forgot about that salad and ordered their flavored chicken alfredo (I know... I'm weak!).  I had a few minutes to look over their menu. You get a choice of several noodle types and then you pick a sauce; and boy do they have options! You can pick from red sauces, white sauces, pink sauces! I will definitely be coming back to check out their spicy fra diavolo!   Anywho, back to my dinner.  You get complementary bruschetta and bread before your meal (a lovely surprise). When my pasta came out, one taste and it was love at first bite! The number of bad alfredo dishes I've had in this city over the past few years melted away in that bite.  Creamy, not too cheesy, not too thick, the texture was just right.  The "flavored" part comes in with the onions and peppers they cook into the sauce.  It adds a layer of flavor that makes the dish pop!  The servers were quite friendly.  I spoke with a young lady who told me that this was a family owned restaurant and her father was the cook.  I love supporting local eateries and I think they have guts opening nearby a popular Italian chain restaurant.  Skip the chain... come here instead!   Note: they only have about 4 tables inside.  If you are dining in, this is not the place to bring 25 of your closest friends.  Order to-go instead!

NWfJckcKLKBohc51CIRWeQ.text: Took my daughter here for lunch. Cute little mom-and-pop place. Service was superb. The food was really tasty. I had Pink Diablo (Amazing!!) and the kiddo had Fettuccini Alfredo.

dfuQmwjRXAKwSY6AJGvI1g.text: I love this place!! I ordered the gnocchi in the pink vodka sauce and I finish it every time! There is so much sauce on the plate that I love to dip the free bread in it.    My mom got the butternut-squash ravioli in the 5 cheese sauce and it was to die for.  It is sweet but it is the best! You have to be careful when reheating the 5 cheese sauce if you take it home because it loves to separate just like all cheese/cream based sauces.   Our order came out fast but after we placed ours, there was a ton of to-go orders that made the kitchen get backed up. Just an FYI.

h8KsKVau5bPZfvBvAoqASw.text: I have read & heard great things about this place. I really like the idea of create your own pasta where you choose your pasta , sauce , and toppings like meat and mushrooms , etc. Each single one is individually priced. Maybe if I ordered the more "dinner-type" menu items & went all out w/ my pasta I would have appreciated the food here more but we settled with their lunch specials since we thought it would be a good deal since comes w/ drink + bruschetta for about 10$.  Lunch menu options were limited and basic in terms of pasta choices and sauces. Hopefully they will expand this category. It also does not come with any meat options (have to pay additional).  I ordered the tri color tortellini + pink vodka sauce (which is mix of their marinara sauce + alfredo sauce + dash of vodka I believe). Tortellini I liked but pink vodka sauce tasted kinda canned. I know it's really not canned but tasted similar. My bf tried the ravioli + alfredo & it was just alright to me. It also looked like I had larger portion size than his. I think I enjoyed the bruschetta more than the actual meal itself.

Was fabulous,  best we've ever had.   Also,  had #30, Caprese which had fresh tomatoes,  basil,  garlic and fresh mozzarella balls.   Amazing!   We saw the Antipasto mistress come out and will order that as well when we come back.   You really must try this place,  everything is so fresh and pasta is homemade.

HpRpH2QLq320v_wIMn9wdw.text: We stopped here while visiting from out of state and we were very happy with our choice. The food was delicious and they give you good portions. The customer service was excellent! It's a small place with a homey feel.

q9EjsZzTnAf5IweAmsj7-A.text: We enjoyed every aspect of our dinner. The pasta was delicious with generous portions and quality ingredients. The staff were also very nice and attentive. We will be be back again and again!

Efnx0utT16QvaNr6LQcIKA.text: Absolutley delicious!! Im a big fan of italian food and tend to grade italian joints pretty hard but this place is great. I came here after seeing a spotlight on them from yelp. Place is very tiny no room to really sit so at first i was thrown off. I ordered a few things to go mostly a couple of ordinary items and i decided to try one special item which ended up being the best. Now this is a pasta place so dont come in here if your looking for chicken parm or veal but the pasta speaks for itself. Everything comes with a slice of garlic bread which is nice because bread always pairs well with pasta. I tried four different types of pastas and found a seafood one to be my favorite. Everything was great though and the portions are huge took me several days to polish off what i had gotten. I suggest this place to anyone looking for good takeout italian just dont expect to find a seat they need a bigger space this place could do wonders with the quality they are offering just need to relocate.

WkWb1C1tuUT0i20iWMTeig.text: Great little find!  Food was excellent. FRESHEST pasta ever. My 10 yr old son begrudgingly ordered off the kids' menu and it was a pleasant surprise for him to see the portion to be quite big!  Quaint and limited seating, but the FOOD IS EXCELLENT!!

H1Mb_tuKKpwsqWIfOfO5oA.text: On recommendation from others, I decided to give this place a try tonight.  Well away from the strip, this is a small shop with 4 (or 5?) tables inside and a couple outside.  I ordered one of their new specials tonight - Linguine black ink squid on seafood sauce with calamari, ahi tuna, shrimp, scallops, sole fillet.  They brought out some garlic bread to start, but I barely had time to sample it (it was good) before my pasta came out.  As they described when I ordered it, it has a strong seafood taste, which, since I like seafood, added to the dish.  Adding to the food, the service was excellent, and shows they care about everything.  Dish and drink being just over $20 (before tip), and it was worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine black ink squid on seafood sauce with calamari, ahi tuna, shrimp, scallops, sole fillet

dmQGVZlUywzerayiX9ibRQ.text: I love supporting local/family-owned places, and found this spot while browsing the "Hot & New" section of Yelp. I ate here on 12-6-15 and 12-19-15.  My first visit, I had gnocchi with the creamy basil pesto. I love gnocchi so much, I've made it myself at home, and this was good gnocchi (good pesto, too). The portion was generous, and you don't just get garlic bread with the dish--it's also brought out to the table prior to your entree. The garlic bread isn't anything special or out of this world, but it's a nice addition.  My second visit, I had spaghetti with caprese "sauce." (It was much more photogenic than the green gnocchi, but both dishes were absolutely delicious). Again, the portion was very generous, and they boxed up leftovers for me. I had leftovers both times.  It's small on the inside, not a ton of seating, but the service is friendly and fast, and the food is fresh and yummy. I hope they do well--I know I'll be back to support them!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with caprese sauce (oil, garlic, tomatoes, basil, mozzarella). Delicious.

f6rzple5EOW4D87dpT42PQ.text: never made it past your logo on the web page to order :( I am on to the next place sorry.

uFrjFZrjhUCSxm9ert0pQA.text: If you are looking for fresh pasta made from fresh ingredients and great sauce, this is the place. The food was hot and delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful. All the pasta is made fresh daily on premises.  We started out with complementary garlic bread with a bruschetta mix. I had the ravioli and had them mix half Cheese, half cheese with the four cheese white sauce. The whole meal was a delightful surprise of fresh ingredients and great flavor. It came out so hot I had to blow on it before eating it and the portion was more than I can could finish.   It is a small shop, about 12 seats indoors. So order takeout if you must, but I'd try to get a seat to get it fresh and hot.   I'll come back to Pasta Idea again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix of Spinach and cheese ravioli. Yum!

u2AayZ_e_ufvHeoBkT_R-A.text: What a delightful find. This tiny little gem has Italian favorites as well as gourmet dishes that are as tasty as any I've had in Italy. I had the pesto Gorgonzola sauce with al dente rigatoni. Delicioso! Service by Jeremias was delightful. I'll be back for sure

0I3c_HT1B79KIt9-ReiQZQ.text: Portion sizes incredible.  Pasta fresh.  Tons of variety of sauces and pastas with variety of spicy levels offered,  Not the healthiest as there's not many greens to add in, but certainly hearty.  This meal will be worth 2 meals in your day for sure.  They deliver, service is fast, and they offer a cute venue on near Lake Mead and Buffalo.  Easy concept, great meal.  Give Pasta Idea a try if you're hungry and want some great pasta that'll last you for days.

Gh8oL4XXPPhOWHER2BRssA.text: What a great new find!!!!!!!! We had the chicken tortellini soup and a pan fried chicken  breast sandwich.     The soup was homemade in house and had  a lot of multi-colored tortellini, plenty of chicken and veggies, but best of all, it had lots of flavor.     The sandwich was a chicken breast pan fried to a golden brown. It came with arugula,tomatoes,onions, pepperoncini, and a great citrus dressing. Definitely one of those sandwiches I will crave from time to time!!!!!!!!!!!! Our waitress was even kind enough to bring us a side of marinara and pesto sauces to dip our sandwich into.     Everyone that works here was super friendly and we definitely will be back. I just wish they had another location on the south side of town.

njArfQiv5ncdvV9V-GlPjg.text: MUST TRY! Spent the weekend in Vegas & was craving pasta the whole time but so glad to have waited till the last day to come across this yummy delicious family owned eatery. The pasta is amazing also got the meatballs as an appetizer and WOW the whole experience was amazing. Thank you Pastaidea :)

4lfqHtHDayjmtYdOtUK97A.text: I came here with a friend the other night to give this new hot spot a try. Homemade sauces and homemade pasta sounded good  to me.  Here at Pasta Idea, your possibilities for dinner seem almost endless. You have the ability to make your dinner what you want it to be. Start by selecting one of the many homemade pastas (around 10 I think). Next, chose your sauce. There are red sauces, pink sauces, white sauces, creamy white sauces. Its maddening when you're hungry and everything looks good.   I settled on papardelle pasta with arrabiatta sauce. The pasta, wider than fetuccini but not as wide as lasagna, was very much al dente and maybe could have used a minute more in the water. My opinion of course. Still, it was delicious. The arrabiatta sauce was amazing. A fresh and spicy marinara loaded with olives. There was just enough spice to get my sinuses working overtime. The olives were rather strong tasting. Very briney. I would have preferred them to be chopped and tossed in the sauce more. Again, just my opinion. The people who run this place are from Italy and probably know what they are doing.  I also had a couple of pieces of garlic toast. One piece I had before my meal came out. It was served with a tomato dressing. Chopped tomato and garlic. Like a bruscheta I guess. That was good. The second piece of bread was served with my pasta amd was perfect to sop up the sauce.  Pasta Idea has a lot going for it with the whole fresh pasta and sauce technique. A freshness that you can most certainly taste. What is working against them is location. They are in a tiny corner suite of a strip mall and they cannot be seen from the street. In fact, I could not even see them from the parking lot. I had to get out and walk around to find them. But if you are in the NW and looking for good Italian food, do yourself a favor and find Pasta Idea.

QvPGRI_vvWQovXmSkzhiMQ.text: Went last night with a group of 3 friends to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our server Hailey was really nice and very helpful with explaining how to order since it was our first time. We ordered a beef tortellini, two chicken alfredos, and the seafood pasta dish (it has an Italian name and I don't really remember it).  The best thing is the portions! They are quite large for the price. I was especially impressed with the seafood dish, it had crab legs and clams I believe. Lots of seafood and pasta for about $20 bucks! The pasta is delicious. My chicken Alfredo had lots of chicken too. I'm used to having to ration it out to have enough sauce and noodles.   We ordered cannoli for dessert and they were delicious, as well! Everything was really good, nice atmosphere. Very kind people. If you are craving high quality pasta (I'm so tired of Olive Garden), then this is the place to go.

IXmJ-1zYZNZrZ0sUuDxxMw.text: Although the carbonara & red diablo tasted good, they were definitely a step down from the perfect flavors made by the previous chef of this restaurant. My friend noticed that the pasta was not as "fresh" like before.

My friend and I looked at each other and laughed. What a joke! How can you be a pasta restaurant and run out of SPAGHETTI.  At least go to smiths and get some spaghetti to keep your restaurant going. 4oucr7B6LSk7S-qm1p2VmA.text: This restaurant used to be fantastic. And I'm talking about less than a year ago. There have been recipe changes and significant portion size decreases over the past several months. Specifically, sauces for dishes have turned 180 degrees in the wrong direction.  I used to look forward to their bruschetta with every order. Today they sent toasted bread with sides of marinara. Why has this place gone to crap? If you have a successful recipe (and they had many), why would you change it and affect the quality of the product?  My only guess is that the owner or manager may not have responsibly handled food costs.  But at the same time, if I'm spending $15-$18 for a simple pasta dish, at least give a decent portion.  I will not be ordering again. Too disappointing.

K3eGMzYeQUSSkmFgW86-dA.text: first time here today and it was a great experience.  who could up fresh pasta?!  build your own pasta dish, they also offer specials of the day.  the portions are pretty big, you'll probably leave with leftovers.  and not to mention the friendly staff.    definitely recommend checking this place out.

dlo_Rwgmsk3cTKiHJ4WMwg.text: I am an Italian originally from Northern NJ so my pasta standards are pretty high. I have ordered from Pasta Idea many times and they never disappoint. The food and service is outstanding. I definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good meal.

nlrizM9wpnIxePfvKUL5tQ.text: Good... My foodie review.  (Seriously though. Great food,  better service and staff. The tomato and garlic bread they serve before the meal could be on the menu itself. The mushroom ravioli special was to die for! )

XesShkAveiML2_IFHLvOzg.text: Amazing!  The best pasta I have ever had. What a treat to find this great homemade pasta restaurant while driving through Vegas. A must for every person living in Las Vegas. The butternut squash ravioli is to die for. Order family style as there is plenty to share.

wxjitjcLklrThG84HEuNWw.text: By far my favorite Italian place! The service is always prompt and the team is very hospitable. I've ordered delivery several times as well and have had no issues. The pasta is always fresh and the sauce is to die for. Love it!

_KpEye5fJRMLEfllUNZ85A.text: There are many Italian restaurants in the valley but few that have a born-and-raised there owner. It was nice reminiscing in a language I grew up with and despite the uncertain as to "what to do" wait staff (I'm sure he'll grow into it within weeks. Seems like a sharp kid.) and the lack of two of my favorite noodles (penne and vermicelli ) , Pasta Mia, small and quaint, is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. I saw the antipasto plate on the next table over and almost shouted "Bravissimo!". I am told their meatballs are truly scrumptious as well. I will definitely be going back la prossimo volta. Bon Appetito! I had the carbonara and it was terrific. Huge portion and took half home with me. Just as good a day later. I'm hoping to give them 5 stars because I am really in their corner and wish them the greatest success.

iYHe-akDNet2Vs0HckjCBg.text: What a great place.   Fantastic food, well prepared, and very friendly owners.   3 of us ate there and all the dishes were excellent. hc0xrxwafCZcQyyl4vaOFA.text: This is a wonderful place to eat! If you're in the mood for eating out you can come in or if you just want something fabulous for dinner they also do take-out. SKxzx6uW34BxJBIXJ9GSzA.text: Hidden gem. Great food. Great service. First time here and will be back without a doubt.

swt1DbKMyxEx5YgVA91SGg.text: This was my first visit to PastaIdea. Visiting Las Vegas from Los Angeles and craving Italian food, I did an online search and found PastaIdea among the search results. The name almost prevented me from going there because it seems like a strange, and not particularly inviting, name for a restaurant but the food had good online reviews so I decided to try it. The restaurant is very small, has little eye appeal and even less atmosphere. Doesn't really look or feel like an Italian restaurant but looks more like a space that would be used for a coffee bar or frozen yogurt shop. The food was very good - well prepared and flavorful. But the woman that served us, although quite pleasant and helpful, was behind the counter preparing a take-out order for someone and kept putting her fingers in her mouth to moisten them to open the plastic bags to put the to-go containers in. Should a food server be putting their fingers in their mouth and then touching plates to serve to customers? It's disgusting and probably a health code violation besides. Based on the overall experience, I will probably not return in the future.

Y82M70fkjSKl0Qicm5wbSQ.text: You will not find much better than this in town! Pasta Idea is a great concept where you have a price for both the pasta and the sauce.  Pasta's and sauces are made fresh daily and the 3 that we tried were all right on point.  We started with this fantastic fresh made Caprese salad with a beautiful heirloom tomato sliced into 9 pieces sitting on some fresh greens and topped with fresh sliced mozzarella with a balsamic glaze on top.  We just had to finish it all as it was so good and for only $10.95. WOW!  Our server brought us some fresh bread with bruschetta which was a nice touch.  We were getting full already. We each ordered a pasta dish which we soon discovered was to much as week took half of it home for Monday's lunch.  I had the pappardelle puttanesca.  I have not had fresh pappardelle since chef Marc's Parma was open and he only made it special. This is on the menu every day! The puttanesca sauce was fantastic with black tangy olives, nice large capers and small salty slices of anchovy in a fantastic tomato sauce.  The other guys both choose spaghetti with garlic lovers sauce and flavored chicken alfredo sauce.  We all shared each others dish and were more than happy with the flavors.  Even though this is a 30 minute drive for us it is well worth it to drive for a fresh meal like this.  The sauce and pasta combinations are just limitless with this concept.  It is a very small mom and pop place but it is bright and cheerful and the owners take good care of you.  The 3 of us ate for $60.02 including the tax and before the top.  We can not wait to go again.  I posted pics of our meals. Enjoy!

GdnIdGzfvl6OzTD1IiVgJg.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while and it did NOT disappoint! The location is small and cozy which I love. It's so hard sometimes to find mom and pop shop style restaurants here in Vegas that it's exciting when you find one that's REALLY good. They have a big variety of pastas and sauces. I had the the fettuccine Alfredo and you could defiantly tell that the pasta was homemade and the sauce was creamy, delicious, and flavorful. I was greeted by two people as soon as I walked in.The gentleman that helped me explained the menu and told me about all the different options. He was patient with me while I chose what I wanted. I ordered to go and the food was ready in about 10 minutes. The portion was good for the price definitely something two people could share. *Bonus you get warm garlic bread! See again soon Pastaidea!

It's a small place that is a bit hidden, but is definitely worth the visit. The food is phenomenal. I almost always get the Pink Diablo fettuccini, and it never fails to be delicious! 0oHH5YhxQRrSAKQtwFUGjw.text: My husband and I ordered pickup. When we got the food home, my meal had items in it that were not listed on the menu ( I don't eat meat and it was loaded with bacon, which was not listed in the ingredients on the menu). We called the restaurant to make sure we got the correct item we ordered, and we did. They explained this is how this specific dish is served. The man on the phone said he would replace it with something else. We went back to the restaurant, and the person we talked to on the phone was not there, of course, and the girl that was there, said she could give us a $3 credit. Three dollars does not cover the $20.00 spent on the food I could not eat and was mislabeled on the menu. My husband was please with his food, however, the service was so bad, we will not return. It's important for a restaurant to remember that service is just as important as the food you serve. There are hundreds of good restaurants in Las Vegas, and I would recommend one with good food and good service.

pTGW3T3kC-rxpG-5RARa3g.text: Recently ordered through Yelp Eat 24 and was extremely impressed. Had four unique pasta dishes to share with my roommates and all were amazingly fresh and flavorful. The ravioli and tortellini were highlights, but the Diablo Sauce was the True show stopper ( red or pink, both unreal ). If you're looking for great handmade fresh pasta, look no further!

ln0OLpGd5aJGnQWRGLTMPA.text: I ordered lunch on a rainy day and they did not disappoint!   I ordered the pesto with chicken dish with pappelle noodles and then a kids portion spaghetti and meatballs.    I first tried the pesto dish and at first bite it didn't taste like much.  Second bite, I scooped up more sauce and got a piece of chicken, yum!  Third bite, this is good in my book!   Ok on to the meatballs... it was a little tough to cut with the plastic fork so I just bit into it.  Ohh, it's meaty.  Got some noodles with sauce, oh yea, that's what it's about!  The mariana sauce is bold and flavorful, it packed a good punch.  The spaghetti was cooked perfectly.  Oh and the kids portion is huge!  It could feed my nephew and me!   Needless to say I had tons of left overs.  I can't wait to try the other dishes here.

UxHx4RP2TA2O9EM1ztLuWg.text: Absolutely great food ! The smell when you walk in is great .... like the Italian Home kitchen !  Employees are super pleasant . Portions are great for the price too .

Iunc5NEe8sHMQabNrx7MCQ.text: This is a small immaculate restaurant which is a unexpected surprise. Looks like a chain restaurant but good reminds me of the real Italy.  Huge portion of antipasto. The shrimp in pink sauce was excellent- tastes like grandma made. Fresh ingredients. Friendly staff.  Quality in an office park

fTE8j4HsHe828-p1-QAsVQ.text: I'll be the first to say it: when I drove by, pulled up the rave reviews, and visited their website, I kind of scoffed at their claims of fresh-made pasta and sauces. Noodles & Co has been doing this for years, and we already have Mac Shack as a local version- same concept for all.  But my dinner here was really pretty great- I dig the modern kitchen decor, and the service is charming with a prominent Italian accent and genuine warmth. You pick from a variety of pastas and sauces, and add on apps, salads, soups, and/or desserts if you so desire. Note that pastas and sauces/toppings are priced separately, so this can add up- it's no bottomless Olive Garden bargain.   The mushroom ravioli ($5) was a generous portion of large, lightly-stuffed pillows. I opted for the pesto gorgonzola ($9), which was creamier than expected and quite rich. I would love to see them add a regular, robust pesto to the menu rather than just the cheesed version.  Was a bit disappointed with the caprese salad ($11)- the tomatoes were underripe and flavorless, which didn't rise to the level of the the fresh mozzarella, basil, and other vegetables. I realize they're new, but until they can get a supplier who can provide fresh, ripe tomatoes, perhaps this should be sidelined or only featured as a special.  Split the pasta and salad for a large dinner, gave the rest to my guy- along with the complimentary bruschetta that comes with each order. Giant amount of food, total was just under $30, with tip.   NOTE: The lunch "specials" offer very limited, basic selection. Hopefully they will expand what is covered in this category. I currently cannot recommend it as a lunch spot, despite working nearby.
