pTgz7KbgmjIQRMWaDnyy0Q.text: So I need some pasta. Didn't want to drive. Punched in Spaghetti near me and found PastaIdea. Been driving past this place for two years and never saw it. Well ya don't need to worry about that. Small intimate family owned real Italian. I'm not even Italian. I've had Spaghetti from the Strip to Centennial Hills. For me pasta is either an emotional event or may as well be Chef Boy R Dee. This is up there with the best in town. The sauce has a nice tangy that I'm still trying to place and I didn't have to fight to get the meat sauce to last. Good stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hyy9KfUqk1c_U6KL_bFFBw.text: It takes a lot for me to make a post like this. I have no idea how this place has good ratings or has stayed in business. We had a group of 4, and it took an hour (with no apologies) for us to get our food. It was not hot and mediocre at best when it did arrive. My pasta cost $18. We should have gone to Bucca di Beppo next door if we wanted tasteless pasta.

CitXhHq0rMXHd2UuYroNwg.text: Stopped here on a whim the other day. Honestly my expectations were reserved.  I have eaten alot of really fine Italian food in my life.  The place is quaint, clean and pleasant.  I was greeted by the owner's son who patiently explained their concept snd even offered tge lunch special pricing to me even though it was past the posted time frame. I ordered rigatoni with arrabiatta sauce and went home. Man was I surprised!! Take out pasta which was still warm after a 15 minute drive home. The pasta was cooked perfectly and tge sauce was the best I have tasted since keaving NJ 21 years ago. The garlic bread was soft,and warm and delivious when topped with fresh bruschetta. Don't pass on this gem of a restaurant.   We ordered deliver last night and my entire family enjoyed it. Eat here please I want this restaurant to thrive!

fBdPR_IPjmi__ebrHjpbTQ.text: Second visit still my favorite Italian food that I didn't have to cook!   I got the chicken parm and upgraded the side.  And it was worth it.  And just so u know there two cannoli in one order. But I ate every bit. Wife got the tricolor tortellini w cream sauce. We ended up sharing all of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QbTQ55fxeDKCbvC4TaIzxA.text: Absolutely blown away by this gem!  It was our first time their last night and wow!  The customer service was phenomenal!  The food was SO delicious and SO fresh!  Everything is made to order and that truly is the case.  I ordered the basil pesto creamy cheese ravioli and it was the BEST pasta in town!  Lol then I tried my husbands chicken Alfredo pasta and that was just heavenly... HIGHLY recommended!  They are also SO generous with the portions of everything!  Also while you wait you get the most delicious garlic bread with a very unique tomato dipping sauce!  So good!  And don't forget dessert!  We ordered cheese cake (so rich and creamy) and a tiramisu (so fluffy and the custard was almost like an ice cream... yummy)!!!!  The restaurant was so clean, tidy, and had a very warm and cozy family feeling to it with such a friendly staff!  It is a awesome place for a date night or a family dinner!  I don't see us ever going to Olive Garden again or any other pasta place for that matter!  We will be going back SOON and I will update with pictures!  Again HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_eou_cksbY6lGH5QplmPCg.text: This is the best gluten free pasta I have ever had. The sauce is very flavorful and delicious. The sausage and peppers are wonderful. Closest thing to North Beach in SF I have had in Las Vegas. Imported ingredients from Italy.

rsL6oJUVHRS2i2kuL2imng.text: This place is by far the best pasta place I have ever tried , the pasta was amazing and the noodles were so fresh and are really homemade . Our waiter was extremely nice and polite and very attentive . They serve really big portions and you get full quickly . I absolutely loved this place and will definitely recommend . I really cant wait to bring the rest of my family to come and try it . The food is so full of flavor and everyone is so welcoming , walking into this place and eating here you feel like you're at home having dinner with family . If you haven't tried this place you're really missing out it's AMAZING . It will probably be one of the best places you eat out at .

8nchjtSr3BrAiHYCz5sE0A.text: This is a great place to go to when you want quality pasta in a casual format. I get the macaroni and cheese which is my favorite! It is very reminiscent of a cheesier alfredo with a crumb top, but it is just so so good. They serve all orders with a piece of garlic bread, which is equally delicious. It is cheaper than some dishes you would find in olive garden, and it is great that you can just get whatever you want to-go if you are in a rush but want good food. The only down side is that it is very very small place. If you have a larger party, I would not suggest you go here. But you should definitely give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara, Mac and cheese, and Caprese salad

koa2Plfbso7t4OQBEgkEzg.text: This has quickly become my new go-to for Italian food. All of the sauces have been amazing, and the pasta has been cooked perfectly. The deserts also have been great, and their tiramisu is probably my all time favorite. Service has also been wonderful and friendly every time I've been here. Overall, it's a great little hole in the wall kind of place.

A98am7ewgaqOVGzjU8sIsg.text: Awesome and fast Italian, dine in, pick up, or delivery.

7xF3JzgYbaDFZGhkbjx60Q.text: I've been to the restaurant 4 times for my to-go orders. I don't eat there because the restaurant is fairly small.   The first visit was great back to 3/2017 was great, I'm a big meat ball pasta fan, so I ordered their meat ball pasta with meat sauce. The pasta was great with nice flavor.   I went back two more times after the first visit. That's when things start to go downward. I didn't get the meatballs with my order, and the portion was very small for the price. I called the manager and he promised he would make things right.   I've decided to give it one more try, I placed my order on eat24 and noted "please include the meat balls this time". They did include it this time, but the meat balls were under cooked, plus I got an extra metal string as a souvenir. The 5-inch metal string looked like either from a wine bottle or a can. I almost swallowed it....  I regret to give them too many chances to fix the issue. Their kitchen needs some serious management. I give them 2 stars for the sake of the first good experience.

dx3fNv-xfUqK4aqWPAEG2A.text: Great concept, super friendly service. Small little place mainly for takeout (seats about 15) excellent pasta great texture and super flavorful sauces. They make their pasta from scratch in house and you can taste the difference. Some of the best pasta Ive had in a long time. Seriously good. 5/5

k4MjQCjqcwXilZXvjeljfA.text: 4th time here in 3 weeks! Love is an understatement I have for pasta, haha. Luckily my friend is a yelp elite and she showed me this place. I owe her my life now HAHA! But seriously everything is so good. I've had the carbonara with pappardelle, gnocchi with basil pesto and Gorgonzola, and simple fettuccine with 5 cheese sauce. Today I got the Brie cream sauce with shrimp, tomato and asparagus with fettuccine. (It's called the gnocchi special but I substituted the noodle) SO GOOD. It's a small place, so I'm not sure I'd have a bunch of people come at once. If it was closer to me I'd get it delivered everyday.

S8qVEqEMYGFEe0UJEEIQVw.text: Ummm....was so not disappointed! Didn't know what to except but this is the real deal. Oh my. Seriously every bite was so yum!!! The pasta quality was perfect and the spaghetti sauce was so perfect rich, flavorful. ...I just can't.   Mix the Mac and cheese with a bite of spaghetti... I can't wait to try more dishes!  Tiramisu was also pretty darn perfect!

abcWkpcZVZvCm4wreLex_A.text: This place is a great idea. You choose your pasta (they have a nice selection), then you choose your sauce. I chose spaghetti with a meat sauce just to be on the safe side since this was my first time eating here. The sauce tasted great, it was very meaty and flavorful. The bread came with the order and it was wonderful. I'm a bread person so I would have liked more than one slice, at least two for the price. The place is small so be prepared. I'll definitely come back.

gcmbv0bitZmdJBG1NvQtlg.text: Great tasting homemade pasta! You choose the pasta, then your choice of sauce. It is a very different concept than anywhere else I've been before but definitely very good. Everything was packed with flavor and so fresh! We will be back again for this. I had the fettuccine with chicken Alfredo sauce and chose to add mushrooms. My husband had the 3 cheese tortellini with marinara. Each meal comes with garlic bread and bruschetta.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ms7mcgsxPc9OL7Zs11NApg.text: I recently got takeout from this place, and I totally loved it!   I got the pappardelle noodles, and they were so fresh and delicious! I got the Fra Diablo sauce with Shrimp and Scallops, and the sauce was good! Insanely flavorful and a good amount of spice. Not sure if I would get it again, just because the scallops are chewy little mini scallops, but the shrimp were awesome.  We also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I didn't taste it, but it smelled so good.   Lastly, the Nutella cheesecake was great (and cheap!) Perfect way to end the meal. The staff was really nice too when we ordered and picked up.  I am so excited to dine in here and try more dishes! Totally impressed with the quality so far.

eLRGF3gbgy68a8eV-f4TFg.text: The service and food were really good along with the potion sizes. The place is way too high though. We had 3 adult meals and 1 kids meal, no drinks and it was almost $60.00 before tip. I could have gone to Bucca for that price and had sodas and such.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pick your pasta and then sauce.

r1sxBHcJgpZcHsLZbW9xxw.text: This place was awesome... the desert didn't make it outside :) people were super nice

8bf1dJI3hs26l0pgCh2vyw.text: The newest pasta shop in town is serving up generous portions of delicious pasta.  We arrived on a weekday night and were surprised by how packed they were. The restaurant is tiny so only a handful of tables are available for dining in. They had a large table reserved for a party that was coming in so we had to wait for one of the already occupied tables to vacate.  Our patience was rewarded and we were seated quickly and allowed to peruse the menu. I was torn between all the great options, but settled on the pappardelle with Diablo sauce. My pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce had a great kick.   Portions are not for the faint of heart so we had plenty of leftovers after our meal was said and done. Great spot and happy to have this quick serve option in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parpadelle with red Diablo sauce
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle with red Diablo sauce

xSN7xqr3aEYDS2bP_L40eg.text: It's such a shame to come back to this place and have to rate it so low. Pastaidea a few years ago was my wife and I's favorite pasta place to go to. It was actually a place we found off yelp, and we loved it so much. But the last 2 times we've been, the food quality has been so low, and no where near worth the price you pay. Before, the food was cooked to perfection, and now the chicken is tough and you can taste the places they take shortcuts now. No longer does everything taste fresh but it feels like you're paying 20+ dollars for food made out of incredibly subpar ingredients. The prices have also gone way up, and for way less food. The last meal we had was nearly 40$ for the two of us, and the portion was so much smaller than what we expected. These last 2 times we ordered were from takeout, and perhaps that's why the quality was so low, but that doesn't excuse how unsatisfied we both left. Perhaps the dine in experience is just better, but for now we will be avoiding eating here.

e47Grm3LFHenc0d-s0n75w.text: Had the chicken parm and was completely let down. The pasta was over cooked and mushy. They added a dump truck of sauce that tasted nearly the same as Prego. The chicken was okay, but the Chef Boyardee sauce and mushy noodles just killed it for me.  The chicken parm and a fountain soda, including tip (20%) came to $25, which is a complete ripoff. NEVER going back.

lV6AHqcZHGsYbMjBTLnGvQ.text: Pastaidea is amazing Italian.  I wish they had salmon because I eat kosher so I normally can just do the pasta but regardless the food is to die for.  My favorite dish is the cheese ravioli with pink sauce by a land slide.  I thought the Alfredo dish was too heavy for my liking.  I order here all the time. Seriously delicious italian!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hijrt9_g-0fOCuBB2ot5SQ.text: Love this place!! 14 different options for types  pasta/noodles and  plenty of sauces and options for toppings of protein and vegetables. The management is great at suggesting options depending on how you want your dish tailored. EVERYTHING is made in house, so it's all super fresh. They also give military discounts and have coupons if you're not!

44vFro3WNmcwMmB-rjPzgA.text: This is great pasta period.  Fresh - the sauces - which matters MOST - are tasty, hearty, plentiful & HOT - we have this delivered mostly and it comes HOT and FRESH!  Awesome pasta dishes - meat sauce - meat ravioli which is impossible to find anymore! Spaghetti and meatballs are yummy!  Seriously - this IS the place for Italian pasta and you'll keep coming back for more!  PS - they smartly ship take out in BOXES - NOT Styrofoam which makes noodles MUSHY!  One of the few restaurants to figure this out yet!

rMjctgobLKR9_GdsufraBw.text: THIS IS AMAZING!!!!  Best pasta I have ever had!  I especially loved the chicken marsala. (however everything was really good) The staff is incredible. Very very attentive.  The lasagna is a hot item get it while they have it. Gluten free noodles are available as well. The pasta is cooked to perfection, I love everything about this place mostly because the food is so good. :D  I highly recommend !

Rg4WzqnNfYCyBbup4NjCuA.text: Love coming here.. you could tell the pasta is freshly made! I always get the Alfredo chicken and it's soooo good I love! Yes it can be pricey but it's the same price as going to Olive Garden but better quality and less wait time!  Also comes with freshly baked bread for every order!

zKG2stucbkZD5C3MHs-rvg.text: A variety of pastas and sauces to choose from, this is definitely a hidden gem away from the noise and crowd of Vegas. The layout is also hip and cozy. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a laid-back, cozy dinner either with your family or significant other.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian White Sauce with Gnocchi

KtyLRFOg5-dnNhYdAi9SkA.text: Good service and amazing quality food! There are so many options and a lot of classics it's a little pricey but it's definitely worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good service and amazing quality food! There are so many options and a lot of classics it&#39;s a little pricey but it&#39;s definitely worth it

t_kHNKErjmyvjkbRCjU8YA.text: I had a craving for linguine and clams one day, so a friend and I traveled here from across town. As usual, this place rocked.  The clams were small, but they give you a huge portion. Easily two fistfuls. The sauce had just the right amount of garlic, and the taste of the clams really came through in spite of the amount of parsley and garlic. Really, a simply incredible rendition of a classic Italian dish. The only adjustment I'd prefer is a slightly thicker sauce.  The ambiance is perfect for lunch, and the service was exceptional. I wish I could remember his name. A very tall, young guy who knew the menu well and provided just the right amount of attention to the table.  See you again soon, Pasta Idea!

1ERPdIh2ng3IRG7jJkKIyQ.text: I've ate at this location 2x I enjoyed the pasta. However I feel it's pretty expensive you have to order the sauce and style you like and depending on what type of noodle you pay another $5+ extra. Another thing that bothers me there hours of operation on there door is incorrect they say there open till 9am but then we went there at 7:00 to find them close and that wasn't the first time.

D3gDApDKc9o_I_KxdvITLg.text: We just walked out of this place. The people there didn't care that someone walked in and didn't seem very helpful. That's ok because it seemed very pricey. $15 for spaghetti then it goes up from there more power to you .

jRZpaV_WK-0SgPoNKcTIPw.text: Easily 5 stars based on price and quality. You chose your own noodles then choose a sauce. They have almost any combination of pastas and sauces you can think of. Def worth what you spend and the amount and quality you get.   Small, clean, family ran, and overall quality pasta dont need pricey olive garden or macroni grill when you got this place.

eP1ErU1-k-AkVOsDvHvX6Q.text: So I've been coming here the past 6 months or so. I really enjoy the food but the last two times I've gone recently the meat has been really Fatty. Seems like they are using lesser quality stuff or trying to save some money. Hopefully it was just a bad batch or something. Other then that the service is WONDERFUL. Minus these last two visits, the pasta has been the best I ever had.

bXWLUSNmpicxOpFas7736w.text: Delicious! So Many options to choose from and every last one of them is 100% authentic. Portion sizes are huge and the owner is very kind and enthusiastic. I love the idea of "fast" and inexpensive Italian food and this one delivers with no compromises. You know you're in the right place when an Italian signore enjoys his lunch next to you.

eAMvWjy1q_xGhEHjnZ-XuA.text: Update:   My husband and I were informed by the Owner of pasta idea that December 31 was their last day in business. I then posted a review indicating our disappointment in them closing and selling out because they are truly the best pasta place around.   I was subsequently reported for 'lying' because the business is still open. I actually just spoke with the NEW owner, and yes it was sold on 12/31/16. They were not supposed to use the same name "pasta idea" but apparently some deal was worked out to keep the name.  So the facts are: its a different owner, and different menu, with the same name.  The woman on the phone was super pleasant and understanding about the situation, and she encouraged us to go in and try their new menu. We will actually be doing that today for lunch!

ilK90E8tGhrxY56JcNbXFw.text: Absolutely great pasta place. Had the seafood ciopino with crab, mussels, clams, and fish over fettuccini noodles. Only 5 tables in this small pasta shop so there is a wait for a table sometimes but the wait is worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood ciopino over fettuccine noodles

fNbXzRX8zzlxo6vSmPizFA.text: This is my all time favorite place in Las Vegas! The pasta is made FEESH TO ORDER. Their food is real and their flavor is impeccable. I felt like I was in Italy! Such a sweet family owned place that I wish could become a chain! Best service, fresh free bread with pesto sauce and bruschetta. What more could you ask for?

ngYsUyvGKWXb_ghsNLEWzQ.text: Great food. Great service. Love the homemade pasta (bigoli is my favorite). Will definitely be back.   Just one suggestion: bring back the mushroom, sausage and asiago white sauce! That was the best and now it's no longer on the menu.

sVp0e3vUnfqN-oBHtkg-6Q.text: Hidden gem!  Tasteful Italian cuisine.  Owners are from Venice.  Choose your pasta and your sauce.  Generous portions.  Skip Buca di Beppo a block away and treat yourself to delicious authentic Italian food.  The food here is so good!!!Meal comes with bruschetta.  The Nutella Cheesecake is out of this world.  Great food with great service.  Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!  Cioppino over fettuccini
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 OFF $25
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bLB8UUbrvwQRyKttD8IrLQ.text: I think the idea is great pick pasta, pick your sauce, pick your protein. There are ask many possibilities.  Plus they have specials.  Today I got the short rib ravioli, really creamy sauce the ravioli's stuffed with a generous amount of short ribs. You couldn't ask for more. I also tasted my daughter's mac 'n' cheese get it I would have killed it but she would've like that. The food is cooked by real Italians too so it taste like it should.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer gone before I posted.

A7srIH-HePWi1JLs3s7l5A.text: Happy tummy gives thumbs up (boom) to small local restaurant serving several fresh pastas. The pasta can then be mixed and matched with various sauces. The group of us  shared a caprese salad which was fresh and flavorful.  I had the cavateli and garlic lovers sauce (chicken, plenty of minced garlic, broccoli and sun dried tomato). It was cooked perfectly and very tasty. There was enough pasta to share but we all ordered what we wanted and now we are taking the yummy leftovers home for lunch ( or breakfast?) tomorrow.

hEPdGuwPZKhTH0cwTOvgDA.text: Great place for pasta. Very clean inside and food is delicious. Will definitely go back again.

mKBRqC8S4qu7oxtMImV50g.text: Stop in on s business Saturdy. Forgot to take a picture of our food. But FANTASTIC! I had the mushroom ravioli and Trentino sauce (speck, mushroom,  peas, white sauce). Will definitely be back

mUHUBPH82n_9_PPQN6GV0w.text: To me this is better than ordering from Olive Garden!  The portions are great and offer many varieties of pasta and sauce combinations!  I was in the mood for rigatoni with meatballs!  However I saw the pink vodka sauce pasta and I think I will get that next.  The meatballs and sauce was very succulent!  The potion was so big I could not finish it.  The only problem I had was the confusion of what came with the menu.  I did not know if the dish came with garlic bread or not.  So I ordered extra!  However it did come with garlic bread.  I also ordered the Caesar salad and my girlfriend ate that she said it was delicious.  You had the option to add chicken or shrimp or both to the salad.  They had choice of meats with the sauce from sausage to chicken and to clams and shrimp! White sauce, pink sauce meat sauce and coordinated with different pasta! The delivery service was on par when used Yelp to order.  I recommend this place to everyone the food was impeccable and the service was great!

qoj3YM6RhIwZ_d8mmL2YCQ.text: For authentic, "home made" Italian Food, go to Pasta Idea on Lake Mead and Buffalo in Summerlin.  Easily accessible from either the 95 or 215 freeways.  Pasta Idea just opened a few days ago, but my husband and I have already been there at least 3 times!  The food is magnifico!   With every meal you get bruschetta (garlic bread w/ tomatoes, basil in olive oil).  The pasta is all home-made from scratch.  They also serve delicious home-made soups.  I have tried several items on the menu, and they are all excellent!  My favorites are:  Meatball Appetizer, the salads, Lobster Ravioli w/pink sauce, Shrimp Alfredo; and their Lasagna is to die for!  For dessert they serve home-made Tiramisu, Cannoli, Cheesecakes; which are great with their cappuccino or espresso made with illy Coffee Beans from Italy.  When you go to Pasta Idea, ask for Chef Chiara!  She is very good at what she does; and she is also very friendly!    Happy Eating! Ciao!

RowO-xlfblazMWAKJjXMrw.text: Prosciutto crudo and fresh mozzrella was really good! On the plate with proscuitto and cheeses you are also getting nice amount of spring mix. The plase was better than I expected!!!

qdAZxXM3rnKEcrED677_3A.text: The cheese ravioli with vodka sauce is pretty good. You can taste the fresh parsley inside the ravioli and the vodka sauce is so creamy. Good quality, homemade taste. The garlic bread they serve before you order is delicious, especially with the diced herbed tomato it's served with. I can't wait to come back and try something else.

c4NlXjDEZrCIkFLZLqJ7iA.text: This place is AMAZING!!...The waiters and servers are super nice and extremely attentive to the customers. It's a small place but is packed with AWSOME FLAVORFUL FOOD!.....This is a great place for anyone that is looking to awake your taste buds I highly recommend for you to come a visit a little part of Italy in Las Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pastaidea - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x68tUkQIM4oeDz_CSu8Cnw.text: Love the simple concept homemade pasta is so much better then box stuff. Everything is tasty and delicious. Very small place so call ahead to make sure their is seating although I've never had a problem.

tD08SkXbLFnTdQgbIabaPQ.text: Love this place! We have only ordered delivery from them but the food is always fantastic and the service is always much faster than the estimate.

B3ukXo1TVaA_-PI8tDPc_g.text: They never disappoint. Do yourself a favor..get the TIRAMISU! I've eaten inside and ordered for pick up. Seems like you get more of the bruschetta when you sit in. I used to order Buca which is right next door to them but not anymore.

uxIi9w4C0VMAn8tDEO3Rhw.text: Great place for lunch or dinner. Pasta is fresh and sauces are amazing. All portions are huge and can be split. We had the arrabiata with tri color tortellini, it was very tasty. They also have gluten free pasta!

ZhDZWCTucOreUCRUwRguFw.text: If I could give no or under zero stars I would, we did take out seeing this place has been rated so high I wanted so much to love this place. We ordered take out and asked for well done pasta and came home to hard noodles super al dente noodles so hard we couldn't even take even a 2nd bite. We called to say how unhappy we were and they were oblivious to the complaint and even the chef got on the phone to give a run down of how the pasta is cooked in the morning and than cooked again to order and he does not have time to sit and cook my noodles the way I like cause it'll take an hour. I didn't call to be talked down like I'm dumb I called cause we paid over $30 for food we couldn't even eat and couldn't get a word in. This place is good for some but please be aware of the ignorance of not listening and sympathize.

CaZ8h8Rem0crOL_4Bij8eg.text: First time here and it was amazing! Great pasta and it's at such a good price! I can see me going back for as long as they're there. Definitely worth a try if you love your carbs!

WE3jPVqroeQvCsOXE7_DNQ.text: This place is consistent, and that's something that's hard to find. My food always tastes exactly the same. The homemade pasta is excellent, reminds me of Grandma's on Sunday. The Chicken Parm was excellent, the Pasta Fagoli was excellent, the tomatoe salad excellent! However, the sauce is a little too acidic which in turns gives you heartburn.   Now for the Cons: Meatballs had absolutely no flavor, does not look homemade, looks like they're shipped in. The Garlic Bread was flavorless and soggy as well.  ** CAUTION ** Very pricey, they charge as much as if you ate a fine dining real Italian restaurant. Although they do give you a nice amount of food, they should consider giving some more for the price!

bk38LgAWf_ap_jS2Vja09A.text: Millions of possible combos of dishes. The staff are extremely friendly and the food is fresh and amazing! The only downside is the smaller size of the restaurant.

TaUSvVONz20L1p5pZd6BUw.text: Really cute, small place to eat. My family and I were very impressed with the tasty, yummy food, as well as the quick service. The food tasted very fresh! We loved the bread with the tomatoes and tried the meat sauce and chicken Marsala. Both were amazing!!! I recommend this place if you're craving Italian.

laHPedfurHa0kFm0jxECBg.text: Really nice staff. Chef accommodated me for being gluten free no prob!! Nice cozy spot. Food was good too. When I'm by summerlin I'll be going back

ltx54rdSIf_D5zSkKM3hdg.text: Hey Out of Towners! If you are going to Las Vegas and looking for a truly wonderful homemade Italian meal (off of the Vegas Strip), this is THE PLACE to go! It's a great little 'hole in the wall!' nestled in the corner of a strip mall.  Pasta Idea is not fancy, but clean and bright.  There are maybe 8 tables for seating.  The owner is an Italian chef and he and his family are very kind and accommodating. Everything is fresh and make to order.  The Caprese salad was spectacular. with fresh, firm beef steak tomatoes, wonderful mozzarella cheese, mixed greens and a flavorful balsamic; easily big enough to serve 2 of us.  I loved the chicken piccata. When you order, you get to choose the kind of pasta you want with your dish (all the pasta is freshly made). There is a a separate charge for each pasta choice which was a little confusing when we saw the bill.  All and all, this place is well worth a visit and the prices are very reasonable.

XrfAJ5lMw5LMR3ST_QE1aA.text: Fantastic! A small restaurant tucked away. The selection is quite extensive- pick your pasta and then your sauce.. BUT here is the catch- the pasta  is made fresh! The dishes are prepared with such pride - the presentation and taste was better than any 5 star restaurant I have ever eaten in. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi over pappadelle served with grape tomatoes and baby asparagus. Just the way the asparagus was cut was impressive.. My friend ordered the cheese ravioli with pink diablo sauce- the dish had with pepperoni, sausage, peppers, pepperoncini and sundried tomatoes spicy - Amazing!  Sam- our waitress was great- Will definitely go back!

lUbQX9M478uqjLgf39SbQA.text: This is quite possibly my favorite place in Las Vegas right now.  The idea of being able to choose which type of pasta and the sauce you want to go with it is incredible.  The flavor they are able to bring out in the sauces and soups are just incredible.

qpjJQYXfjaB08YgqJDcZWw.text: Oh. Yum.  Husband, daughter, and I all loved our dishes (and each other's). Even though we're just in town a few more days, it's likely we'll go back. It is pricier than your average lunch- but the food is far from average.  There are too many choices, because every single one sounds delicious, but somehow we honed in on our pasta/sauce combos pretty quick. The waiter was friendly and helpful, answering questions and providing tips when requested (he eats the food there).  The toast with fresh bruschetta was delicious (breads not fancy, but the bruschetta made up for it!)  The pasta came out pretty quickly, was hot and exquisite. Daughter got tricolor cheese tortellini with creamy basil pesto. Husband got bigoli (awesome thick spaghetti, that reminded me a bit of German spaetsle in texture) with carbonara, and I got butternut squash ravioli with the Veneto. I would probably pair the squash ravioli with something a little lighter.   Ultimately, I think you can't go wrong.

zNQ9dEgcw1uCYBaPidy8lA.text: Abosolutely outstanding.  Pink Diablo sauce was really good.  Both of girls loved their food.  Wife tried all dishes and liked them all.  Service was great.  If you looking for great authentic Italian Pasta this is your place.

oNPu9o4NN4II0H39Oc3Bwg.text: So my boyfriend and I used to come here twice a week and bring friends and it was our FAVORITE place to eat! Food was amazing and the people were so nice. We took about a 2-3 month break over the Holidays and we were so disappointed when we came back. For starters, we were sad when we got here and didn't see our usual servers working. Then we picked our table only to realize that it was covered in ants.. when we told the waiter his respose was "Oh, let me clean the table off for you". Seriously? Just an oh... I was so grossed out! We still decided to stay unfortunately and just move to an ant-free table. There were 2 servers and it took a good while of us staring in their direction to get our order taken.. and when I asked for my sauce without pepperoncinis the women asked me 3 times what I was talking about before having to look at a menu to understand what I was asking. Ugh! So we finally get our food and we both ordered the same sauce, however mine was suuuper light and runny (way too much cream) and my boyfriend's was way darker and spicier. SO DISAPPOINTED!! Sad to say that this may be our last trip....

S9B0n3gJl6ecbUHh8FDlrw.text: Tried this place tonight for the first time! I usually go to Mac Shack but after eating here tonight I will definitely be back! Lots of options for sauce and noodles, big portions and very cute place with really nice staff.

GfFGAlkDPKwwV1EtcyG7vA.text: Wow just wow, my girlfriend found this place while working and said. We needed to try it out. So that is what we did and now will be making return trip after return trip to this Amazing Mom & Pop Italian Pasta Spot! Hand made Pastas and Sauces to die for. She had Fettuccine with Pink Diablo Sauce and I had lobster ravioli with clam and mussel red sauce. We had some amazing garlic bread and when I joking asked for a loaf of it the sop up the delicious sauce our waitress return with a plate of garlic beard which I put to use. I can not wait to go back and try a different combination of pasta and sauce. Vegas has some amazing Italian places and in my opinion Pasta Idea ranks right up the with best of them. Did I mention that both our plates were huge and it was under $50 for the entire dinner! simply fantastic.

GX_5-uMEycEHVAsHL1olyQ.text: Gluten free fettuccine with nearly 40 sauce choices! It's a small place with just a few tables, but it's really a treat for anyone that loves pasta and needs gluten free!

mq5-GZRem8bDhTcKLV91dA.text: One of THE BEST Italian spots in Las Vegas!!!  Fresh pasta and an abundance of sauce choices...I cannot say enough. It's one of my favorites!!!

4szu1fjhjEy1EVl33SKVCw.text: My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out today, even though it was kind of busy I received excellent service from Kyle. The food was amazing, hands down the best pasta place I've been to in Las Vegas. I will definitely eat here more often!

SkVD3fpE21mwrOcZ_xFWNQ.text: This place is awesome! The pasta is homemade and perfectly al dente everytime. The sauces are homemade and whether it's a white wine, a creamy white or red sauce it's fantastic. The service is also fantastic. Our server Carrie is always energetic and knowledgeable with recommendations and a great attitude. Definitely a terrific place and the price is absolutely right. Congratulations on such a unique restaurant and very excited for the future of the business. Can't wait to return.

mKtzCT_Ig9Iunz08skYpaQ.text: I brought my lacrosse team here after a tournament and although the place is small, they were more than accommodating with chairs and tables. We ordered several different tray dishes and they were all incredibly tasty. The staff was so nice, always checking to see if everything was okay or if we needed anything else. Best meal (and best pasta) my team has ever had. We will definitely coming back next time we are here. 5 stars!!!!! Thank you PastaIdea!!!
